content:
Posted: February 21, 2015
												With the right mods and people, this is about as close as you want to get to actual combat [at least for the ground warfare]Arma's best feature is the dedicated modding community, you can find a mod for just about anything for Arma. the game simulates fatigue, breathing and pain effect, as well as weapon weight, meaning that there won't be anybody out shooting a sub machine gun with a long rifle after being shot in the chest at near point blank range. There is a pretty good balistic simulation for vanilla arma but you can find mods for very realistic ballistics. I love pretty much everything about Arma except these two things, of course, nothing is perfect. The game requires a pretty powerful computer setup to run effectively, even with my Nvidia 770 graphics card, larger battles decrease frames quite a bit. And finally, Arma's controls can be rather clunky at times, the stance/lean controls specificly. It can be a problem at close range where a real human could move much faster. Overall- 9.5/10  definetly worth the price if you can run it and enjoy Teamwork and tactical combat.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 8, 2013
												I had to add some more things to this review, as I started to appreciate it even more after some time spent in the game, both playing and creating content.I tend to get rambly, so this is going to be a TL;DR version for you if you don't like reading textwalls: It's just awesome. Very immersive and deep, rewarding, satisfying, milsim experience.1st episode of campaign took me 4 hours of gameplay on its own. Both multiplayer and singleplayer are great, along with the community-made content available via workshop.Looks beautiful on graphics cranked up to ultra. I was even able to set my sampling to 150% while lowering antialiasing to 2x without any performance loss after the recent updates and I have to say - the graphics are phenomenal.Second and third episodes of campaign were good as well, added up towards a complete story which gave me some backup on game's plot and situation on Altis in 2035.Zeus is very exciting, but it takes some practice and experience to provide players with fun time.Fatigue & weapon inertia updates added a lot of depth to shooting.Now there is rotorLib to come along with shooting from vehicles, and that's going to change helo flying entirely.See what I'm doing here? I'm proving you the devs constantly make this game better, it evolves on your eyes, and every day you play it you find something new about it, for example - recently I found out the angular size of the moon is actually correct, the night sky mapping is accurate and you can navigate using the northern star, and measure the distance using your compass and mils on it, like in real life.Enough of this rambling.I have to say it's breathtakingly good. The possibilities it offers, the dev team which continues to add deepness to it...Some people don't like the recent updates, but for me these updates just build up more realism and add to overall greatness. And the team takes feedback into account, having really good policies both on DLCs and on new content put into the game.Things you can do modding it are pretty crazy. I'll give you an example for better understanding:- The game itself, in vanilla version, features pretty complex ballistic mechanics. It also features exhaust pipe particle effect of hot air. What has one to do with another you might ask?Well, a mod author took the first one, added much more deepness to create accurate ballistic simulation, and even used the particle effect I've mentioned earlier to simulate bullet trace effect in high-power optics...Yup, you can do anything you want with this game.

It brings some fun content, i bought the deluxe edition, which was a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ mistake. some of the weapons exist in real life, however they are sadly not named after their real life counterparts, which is understandable because Bohemia Interactive would have too pay for license, but still..Tank gameplay is fine, ai like always can be a bit ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, but hey, it's AI..Jets is adequate, it's not a flight sim, it has the basic flight characteristics so that it works, but calling it a 100% flight sim would be incorrect. and Joystick is almost a must for the jets.Helo's, they are modelled alot better, and i like 'em. and unlike the jets they can be fine without a joystick and pedals, however you would of course be better with it. Online play? well, we all know the history of Arma to be horribly optimised, which i agree to in some extent, but it's also a massive game, and putting that in a multiplayer enviorment where not only you, but other players and several scripts are all rendered in. Very very few can play this game on 100% graphics settings when on a multiplayer server. most put it down to medium or low. Over-all it's a good game, with mods it gets even better. if you like FPS that have a bit larger realism to it, get this. or Insurgency, but insurgency doesn't have tanks and helo's now does it? :)

content:
Posted: March 2, 2014
												Handcuffed by 3 men. Took my shirt and my pants off. They took deep breaths into the mic. All three stole a bags worth of blood from me. Hit me once with their fist each. Left me to die. Broke out. Found a crowbar. Killed one. Ran away. Crawled into a house almost dead. Had a friend come save me. I wasnt gonna be able to make it i thought. We went into another city looking for a blood bag. Upon entering the hospital we were greated by one of the men that almost killed me. The blasted my friends brains on me. I ran out as fast as the game would let me. I ran to a town. Shot after shot was fired at me. I kept yelling into the mic "You suck at shooting!" Nearing at the town i was hit once. I crawled up to the top floor and used my only rag to stop bleeding. By this point i knew I was gone. Tears were streaming down my face as I wished it didnt have to happen like this. I could hear him running along the floor below me looking for me. He came out of the doorway from the stairs and i scream "WAIT!"... He pointed his gone at me. I closed my eyes and braced myself. nothing happened..... I looked him in the eyes as he looked at mine. I told him the bad things i did. I told him about my family. My friend that he killed. I told him how what they did to me i had deserved it. I could see tears streaming down his face. He looked at me and told me something. He told me how he knew i killed one of his friends. He told me how the other was shot in a shoot out. His face soaked with tears he pointed the gun at me. I said "no need. we have both lost something." He put the gun down. "We can end this together. No need for anymore violence. We dropped our stuff and walked to the edge. I looked to my right and he looked to his left. we both said "Thank you.." at the exact same time. We both jumped off the edge and died right next to each other. i felt my soul leave my body.Then i respawned

content:
Posted: November 22, 2014
												I love the Arma Series to death, I have logged well over 1000 hours on Arma 2, but it does have some drawbacks and bugs that can get very annoying.Pros: Combined Operations Warfare (Tanks/Air/Infantry)Great community with lots of servers. (RPG Life/Sector Control/Domination)Amazing mods made by the communityIn-Game Mission EditorHuge mapsGreat gun mechanicsFiring from helicoptersSling loading cargo with helicoptersA good amount of weapons and vehicles to choose fromThe developers update a lotCons:Vehicles randomly blow up sometimesPhysics can be very dodgyThe Engine is pretty old (13 Years I think?)Very poorly optomized, I usually run at about 18 FPS and I can run most games on high settings.If you don't have at least a high-mid range gaming computer don't bother trying to run this.All in all, for everything thats broken with this game, it makes up for it with amazing gameplay especially if you join a group. I play with a realism infantry unit that does operations every week and even though I lag I still have an amazing time. Never have I fealt as immersed in a game as I do when I play ARMA.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
												You need to try it to get a feel if you would like Arma, its not like Battlefield or Call Of Duty. I did buy the game before I even had a PC that could run it and that was a bit of a gamble. I do enjoy the game.I have played both Call Of Duty and Battlefield and this is quite diffrent to both of them. While it is more realistic than both of Call Of Duty and Battlefield there are community based mods that take this further and make the game feel much more realistic (such as ACE).Since Arma 3 is such a large game (as a community) its best that someone buys the game and trys it out. I made a list of Pros and Cons just so you can get an idea of how the game feels.Pros:Wide range of gamemodes and community made contentGreat community backing itDLC is not "forced" appon players (such as Helicopter DLC, players can use the helicopters as long as they are not in the "crew roles"). The main thing being the DLC is not made in a way that you are forced to buy it so you can have a great experience.The modding community does provide a massive range of content that can be used from maps, to new vehciles, buildins and guns for players to use.Single player and offline game play runs very well.Aircraft are easy to fly but they need you to master them. You can learn to fly your self in the editor with helicopters but if you want to get a hand on using them for combat, do the tutorials and then join a mill-sim unit and build your skills from there.Cons: (this is mainly performance related stuff)I recomend installing the main game on an SSD to prevent frame drops, mods and other content should be fine on a HDD but if the mod is causing the game to slow down put it on the SSD with Arma 3. I used to have Arma 3 on a HDD and running around 20  frames per second in multiplayer (this is in kavala on altis when playing KOTH), after using Arma 3 on an SSD I was getting about 60-70 frames per second in multiplayer (in kavala on altis playing KOTH). (Since you proberly don't own the game when looking at this review, kavala is a large town/city on a map called altis, altis is a large island and is based on a real world place called "Limnos" near "Greece").Random memory leaks causing massive frame drops and making the game unplayable for 10-20 minites unless you restart. This can be a problem if your playing gamemodes that are persistant and save data such as KOTH, flying aircraft or you are in some form of combat since you will most likly die.The frame rate will drop quite randomly when playing multiplayer (single player its fine its quite consistant)Server sometimes don't always give error messages on missing dependencys (while this won't affect your every day player, if you host servers this can be really hard in helping diagnose problems. I resently have a problem where I was missing a software dependency and the server would crash without an error message. I have not been able to replicate this since the latest update so I think its been fixed).

content:
Posted: April 8, 2013
												An amazing game! 6.5/10As I started from the Alpha of ArmA 3, I noticed as the game progressed I lost my ability to not only run the game once it hit beta but also blue screened three times. I've had multiple problems and even managed to fix the issue after hours and hours of searching for the answer to the issues. Now as Beta was a complete horror and full release was right around the corner I decided like many others to quit playing and go back to some good old ArmA 2 A.C.E. and waited till the games full release. As I was pumped for the full release I noticed that nothing had changed from the beta. Same maps, same vehicles, same sounds, same weapons, and same factions. The lack of things for the Sea was a huge disappointment because the ArmA 3 engine actually has a working water system and it was completely wasted. The lack of Air vehicles especially no big cargo plane makes traveling on altis boring and hard to move from place to place. Although it says its a ArmA game I dont feel as if it compares to its counter parts. Yes, a graphical update has been put up for the game itself but after playing ArmA 2. I dont feel the immersion of ArmA:Gold Edition and  ArmA 2 in ArmA 3. but, it does have alot of neat things like futuristic vehicles, amazing hud system, stance system, amazing animations, ability for both customization over weaponary/uniform and a bunch of downloadable mods/maps that can keep you playing for hours just like ArmA 2.I'm just disappointed that they didn't take their time on this game. Why couldn't they have made this game better by looking at what players loved in the previous games like the ACE mod or even some of the other cool things like I44, VTE, and etc.Although all the bad things I have said its still a game in development and could possibly have a big turn around. I just hope this game becomes better in the future so I can start enjoying it again.

content:
Posted: August 10, 2014
												As you can see from this review, I have almost 500 hours in the game, so if you're looking for someone who knows it, trust me. Arma 3 is a Military Simulator, which means that you aren't getting the constant grinding, free-for-all match ups you find in FPS games like Call of Duty or Battlefield. It also doesn't get much more realistic than this. But in terms of the actual game, there are a plethora of things to do. There are Altis Life RPG servers, which allow you to play the way you want, within certain constraints of course. There are wasteland servers as well, which is essentially a giant battlefield for you to play in. Also, if you get a group of people, you can run some pretty awesome missions, not to mention have a blast with the Zeus mode, which allows a player to become a game master and run a mission dynamically.Yes, there are bugs. Driving full force with a truck into a tank probably wouldn't cause it to blow up, for example. Rocks, walls, and even chicken-wire fences can disable plenty of vehicles, and sometimes the actual mechanics are pretty slow. But the major bugs that you find are usually because of some faulty coding in a server you play on, such as dropping a truck from a helicopter, only to have it disappear the next instant, or fling back up and blow you out of the sky. Regardless of these, the actual content of Arma 3 is massive, and the situations you can create get to be incredibly intense. The $59.99 price tag on this game shouldn't stop you from buying it, because it is worth every penny. If you want to find some examples of people who play this game and have a great time, you can find a ton of videos on YouTube that may help you in your decision to buy it. Lastly, I mentioned before that this is not a Call of Duty or Battlefield game. They are all there own, and you may think that this game is too slow-paced if you are looking for that run-and-gun format of a game. But whileplaying this game, you find yourself in many different situations. Whether it be sneaking up to a compound while trying to avoid any contact, laser-designating a target for air-support to pulverize, or peaking around and pieing corners in a CQB scenario, you will find thousands of these unique situations, which make this game worthwhile to nearly every fan of FPS's and MILSIM's alike.

content:
Posted: February 23, 2015
												Arma 3 is a military simulation game. Let me tell you about it.First of all, some history.All of these titles lasted a few years, with continuing updates.Operation Flashpoint came out in 2001, and was a very good game for it's time.ARMA: Armed Assault was released in 2006, and was also a very good game.ARMA 2 was released in 2009, and was probably the best WW2 shooter out there, if not the best shooter, and is still being played today.Arma 3 was released in 2013. Now, this little game is seriously the next gen stuff. With amazing graphics and sounds, a new story-rich campaign, a futuristic setting and beautiful, lush terrain on huge maps is what made it stand out at the time.The game is set in the republic of Altis and Stratis, which are both small Greek islands, although they're MASSIVE for a game's map. There are three teams fighting for these islands, first of all are the locals, the AAF or Independents. They are the Altan Army Forces, and, because pressured by their local guerilla crisis, have made some European and American allies, NATO, or BLUFOR. Although, towards the end of the first episode of the campaign, there are 'entanglements' and the AAF decide to turn on NATO, and then CSAT, a a combination of Asian forces, teams with the AAF. Also, NATO is having a financial crisis. Oh, what fun.It has a few original gamemodes, which were released with the game originally, but so many more have come from the vast modding community.Altis Life, Wasteland, Invade and Annex and Breaking Point are just a few examples. I'll tell you a little bit about each.First of all, Altis Life. It's a very exadurated take on real life. With cops, medics and civilians. As a civilian, you can make your money in legal ways, like apple picking and mining with a liscence, although you can make it in illegal ways like drugs and turtle poaching. You can also go to a rebel town and buy some illegal gear and do more illegal things.As a cop, you'll have to stop all this illegal behaviour. Doing searches and inforcing the law, rebels will have to look out for these guys.And medics, if you're injured, can come and revive you. May sound simple, but it's actually a very dangerous job.Here's a very good Altis Life server: http://reignofterrorclan.enjin.com/With Wasteland, you have your three teams, BLUFOR, OPFOR and Independent.As BLUFOR or OPFOR, you have to work together with your team to kill the other team and the Independents, while getting money from missions or killing players to buy new things, like guns and veichles.As an independent, you're in a massive free for all against the other teams and all the other independents, unless you group up with some others.Here's a very good Wasteland server: https://www.gametracker.com/server_info/play.ultimatewasteland.com:2302/With Breaking Point, it's a zombie game, so basically DayZ. DayZ started as an Arma 2 mod, which eventually became a standalone game. Now, however, it's also an Arma 3 mod. Scavenge for supplies, kill or befriend other players while watching out for zombies.Sign up to play here: http://www.thezombieinfection.com/Also, Invade and Annex is more of a slow paced military simulation. With classes, you can pick your role and fight against enemy AI for the islands. Using all of the game's original content and a little bit more, this gamemode is seriously some good fun if you're more of a strategic fighter.It is overall an ultra realistic game, with tons of veichles, models and weapons, even very realistic weather and day - night cycles, and there's a lot more stuff from the modding community. It has a really steep price at $60, but I picked it up on special, and even if I did buy it for the original price, it's worth it. Trust me, it's worth it.If my horrible explanation didn't help you, check out the Arma 3 Youtube channel. If it did help you, check it out anyway.https://www.youtube.com/user/Arma3officialThanks for reading my review and, if you decide to get the game, I hope to see you!Frank

Broke out. Found a crowbar. Killed one. Ran away. Crawled into a house almost dead. Had a friend come save me. I wasnt gonna be able to make it i thought. We went into another city looking for a blood bag. Upon entering the hospital we were greated by one of the men that almost killed me. The blasted my friends brains on me. I ran out as fast as the game would let me. I ran to a town. Shot after shot was fired at me. I kept yelling into the mic "You suck at shooting!" Nearing at the town i was hit once. I crawled up to the top floor and used my only rag to stop bleeding. By this point i knew I was gone. Tears were streaming down my face as I wished it didnt have to happen like this. I could hear him running along the floor below me looking for me. He came out of the doorway from the stairs and i scream "WAIT!"... He pointed his gone at me. I closed my eyes and braced myself. nothing happened..... I looked him in the eyes as he looked at mine. I told him the bad things i did. I told him about my family. My friend that he killed. I told him how what they did to me i had deserved it. I could see tears streaming down his face. He looked at me and told me something. He told me how he knew i killed one of his friends. He told me how the other was shot in a shoot out. His face soaked with tears he pointed the gun at me. I said "no need. we have both lost something." He put the gun down. "We can end this together. No need for anymore violence. We dropped our stuff and walked to the edge. I looked to my right and he looked to his left. we both said "Thank you.." at the exact same time. We both jumped off the edge and died right next to each other. i felt my soul leave my body.Then i respawned

Posted: March 1, 2016
												One of the most punishing, grueling, and rewading experiences I've had in gaming, ever. You aren't rewarded with XP and meaningless points per say, this is the only game I've played that has and continues to reward me with knowledge. (Garage bookshelves need not apply) I've learned more about the military, teamwork, combat, and aviation than any game that I've played before. Compass bearings, map grids, team leadership, these are things that were completely alien to me before I got invested into this game. If game communities like CSGO, Battlefield, and League of Legends are on the far end of the toxic spectrum, ARMA 3 would be on the opposite. I've never met a more devoted, compassionate community that doesn't help others because they need to, but because they want to. That's something genuinely special. To forego this game in favor of the cut and dry, annual release arcade shooters filled with whining manchildren and screeching tweens that still seem popular to this day, is a huge disservice to yourself.

content:
Posted: September 17, 2013
Arma 3Twelve Thirteen Fourteen Fifteen hundred hours. I'll be damned. I have to say, you must wonder what it is about this game that keeps me coming back. I've always loved this series, and I think it's about time that I give this title a good, hard look. Shall we?GraphicsWhile Arma 3 isn't exactly on the bleeding-edge in terms of visuals, it is nonetheless a quite good looking game; what it lacks in small details it makes up for with an extremely good color palette and very realistic setting. Many games attempt to imitate real life, but Arma 3 is one of the only ones I believe has succeeded, and quite a few times a screenshot in-game will closely resemble a real picture of a Greek island. Furthermore, the game features a very impressive scope, with the main terrain clocking in at 270 km(sq) in size, and the smallest being 20 km(sq). So, for its size, its graphics are more than sufficient, and Arma 3 definitely immerses you in its world.


Oscar Mike 
A Screenshot of Arma 3
By: Lavernius Regalis




AudioArma 3 features decent enough sound design, and while it's not as impressive as the abilities of the Frostbite engine I don't doubt that it is fairly realistic. If that's not your cup of tea, there are always mods that overhaul the sound design to be considerably more realistic. The environmental sounds are also quite nice, and they help a great deal with immersion. The music is not spectacular, but it follows a specific theme, and fits Arma 3 well enough. I don't have any complaints here.PerformanceHere's the one everyone disagrees on. Arma definitely isn't the best performing game, but it isn't the worst, either. If you're considering this game, you need to keep something in mind: Arma 3 requires a more powerful CPU than many other games, but conversely doesn't require as powerful of a GPU. I would also recommend 8 GB of RAM, to play it safe. With my current system, I manage a fairly consistent 50-60 FPS in singleplayer, and similar in multiplayer depending on the server and gamemode.GameplayArma 3 is a slower paced, tactical combined-arms game. It features an in-depth infantry combat system (though grenade-throwing is lackluster) and a good arsenal of weapons, uniforms, helmets, vests, backpacks, and more. The inventory system allows for a great deal of customization, and opens the door for a large variety of gamemodes outside of military simulation. Ballistics are simulated well, and AI is surprisingly adaptive to whatever situation it is thrown into - save for inside of buildings, where it stumbles hard. Vehicles are also a major focus; many feature great interiors, but armored vehicles (IFVs, APCs, tanks) are disappointing in this regard with a plain, undetailed interior. It is definitely not a vehicle simulator, so you won't find a great flight model for aircraft, but helicopters have a respectable enough flight model. Another aspect you're sure to encounter sooner or later is commanding your subordinates. With players, of course, they're usually smart enough to take care of themselves, but the AI requires some major babysitting, which quickly becomes an uninteresting chore. With that said, the command system is still quite powerful, and the range of orders you can give out is virtually unmatched. Indeed, its gameplay is one of the two biggest reasons I keep coming back; there's nothing quite like it if you're looking for long-range light infantry engagements with combined-arms support.SingleplayerI was pleasantly surprised by the singleplayer options offered by Arma 3. The Bootcamp campaign and VR training offers new players a good opportunity to familiarize themselves with Arma 3's controls and mechanics; showcase scenarios allow players to control vehicles and use gear in a safer environment than multiplayer. The campaign is a mixed bag, however. The first two-thirds of the campaign are fairly good, with semi-open world environments and varied missions. These are all presented better than Arma campaigns have been in the past, as well. However, the last third leaves much to be desired. It felt rushed and was much shorter, and less open. Despite this, it was still a decent enough singleplayer experience. What's more, scenarios can be created in the mission editor for either single- or multiplayer, greatly extending the length of Arma 3's singleplayer lifespan.


Under the Aegis 
A Screenshot of Arma 3
By: Lavernius Regalis




MultiplayerIf you are familiar with the Arma series, you already know how many options are present in multiplayer. I was disappointed by the lack of gamemodes provided officially, but this was not a complete surprise. Many of the gamemodes that have been created now by the community are of great quality, and each offer hundreds of hours of gameplay. Plus, co-op missions can be created either in the editor or with the official Zeus "dungeon master" framework and gamemode, which is where many of my hours in-game came from. Numerous groups exist to make Arma 3 their very own, with modpacks many gigabytes in size and unique environments to be found in each, from military simulation to casual gatherings. This is where most of Arma 3's gameplay will come from, and I believe it is a fantastic part of PC gaming. Just remember that if you're ever looking for something more serious than public servers, the best thing to do is to check out a group that plays regularly.[units.arma3.com]Community ContentArma was built around support for community content, featuring an incredibly powerful in-game 3D mission editor, scripting support both in the editor and out, and development tools for creating new content. One of the gamemodes is even designed as a canvas for players to create custom missions on the fly. Arma 3 is still played without modifications, but a large percentage of servers either allow or require modifications, showing how much the community has taken advantage of this so far. It truly allows for some fantastic things, and I absolutely have to mention it here, as it is one of my favorite things about the series.


Contact 
A Screenshot of Arma 3
By: Lavernius Regalis




VerdictArma 3 is probably one of my favorite military games, period. It is one of the longest lasting, and I still haven't gotten bored of it even after one thousand three hundred hours. It definitely isn't for everyone given its slower paced, tactical gameplay, but it is a great platform for a wide variety of experiences thanks to its support for the community; one which I cannot help but recommend.I recommend Arma 3.

content:
Posted: May 18, 2014
												The latest installment for the military simulation franchise which has been around for eons is a very nice step in the right direction in general. Arma 3 Features two new maps called Stratis (which can be compared to Utes of Arma 2) and Altis, which is a mammoth sized map that stretches roughly 27 kilometers in East to West length. The Arma series has been prone to a multitude of bugs and poor optimization, which is still evident in the latest insatllment, yet the optimization has been FAR improved in this version of Bohemia Interactive's spotlight franchise. The graphics in this game are very improved and look beautiful on Ultra settings (that is, if you can run it). This game is still prone to glitches, bugs and sudden extreme drops of framerate without warning. Some of the bugs are eveident in player movent, which has been vastly improved upon the last installment, allowing you to take on 9 tactical positions when shooting. The movement is far less clunky and works much smoother than Arma 2. Some of the movement bugs can mean that you accidentally can get stuck in a rock or wall and end up dying from being squashed. The vehicles have been greatly improved offering far more realistic physics (however the physics are not on the par of games like Forza 5) with realistic vehicle speeds. The vehicles on the other hand are painstakingly delicate and fragile than before making vehicle operating quite frustrating at times. The weapon mechanics have been totally overhauled since the previous Arma game with new damage mechanics and far more realistic recoil effects. Arma 3 also has added a new dimension to its already diverse playability, adding a more in depth (no pun intended) maritime experience. This allows you to dive to the depths of th eocean and use submarises as well. Some of the things I want to see in Arma 3 are missing such as the ability to take cover behind doors of a vehicle whilst riding in it to avoid being shot easlliy (for example, if you are driving or in the passenger seat of a car you can hold a button to allow you character to switch into 1st person view and duck behind the dashboard and door of the car). Another missing feature is the ability to shoot in vehicles with you character's weapons allowing for military simmulation dirve-bys. My final verdict of Arma 3 is a very solid 8.5 out of 10. Arma 3 offers a very vast and expansive game that has a nearly infinite replayability, yet some of its bugs and optimization hold back Bohemia Interactive's flagship series back once more. If these glitches were to be fixed Arma 3 could be a very famous game that could be a serious threat to games like the Call of Duty franchise or Battlefield franchise as well. Buying this game is a choice you will not regret and with a little time and patience, you can have a blast on this game.

content:
Posted: August 3, 2015
												With over 3,100 hours, I think I am more than qualified to tell you about the game. So, what is ArmA 3? ArmA 3 is a tactical fps/third person shooter simulator. Quite a mouthful huh? ArmA 3, I would have to say is by far the best game I have ever played, and until ArmA 4 comes out, the best game I will ever play. Bohemia has truelly one upped most, if not all, shooting games out there to date. And with the mature, professional community that plays ArmA 3, it is not hard to find excellent modifications to the game. Some of the best community game mods I can recommend to you right now are Altis Life and ArmA 3 Life. However, should you find yourself more interested in the tactical side of ArmA, there are units out there that replicate real world military units, that provide tactical gameplay, as well as assisting you to better yourself in the field of ArmA 3. But before you go do anything, be sure to play the campaign, as that will help you learn ArmAs mechanics, and assist you in your career of ArmA. While I myself am still looking for a role play server. There are plenty of MilSim units out there though. 173rd Airborne Brigade, 15th MEU. Currently I am apart of the 173rd and can almost guarantee that you will enjoy it. Recruiting Now. TeamSpeak IP: ts3.173rd.usWebsite Link: http://beta.173rd.us/index.php?

content:
Posted: May 18, 2014
												The latest installment for the military simulation franchise which has been around for eons is a very nice step in the right direction in general. Arma 3 Features two new maps called Stratis (which can be compared to Utes of Arma 2) and Altis, which is a mammoth sized map that stretches roughly 27 kilometers in East to West length. The Arma series has been prone to a multitude of bugs and poor optimization, which is still evident in the latest insatllment, yet the optimization has been FAR improved in this version of Bohemia Interactive's spotlight franchise. The graphics in this game are very improved and look beautiful on Ultra settings (that is, if you can run it). This game is still prone to glitches, bugs and sudden extreme drops of framerate without warning. Some of the bugs are eveident in player movent, which has been vastly improved upon the last installment, allowing you to take on 9 tactical positions when shooting. The movement is far less clunky and works much smoother than Arma 2. Some of the movement bugs can mean that you accidentally can get stuck in a rock or wall and end up dying from being squashed. The vehicles have been greatly improved offering far more realistic physics (however the physics are not on the par of games like Forza 5) with realistic vehicle speeds. The vehicles on the other hand are painstakingly delicate and fragile than before making vehicle operating quite frustrating at times. The weapon mechanics have been totally overhauled since the previous Arma game with new damage mechanics and far more realistic recoil effects. Arma 3 also has added a new dimension to its already diverse playability, adding a more in depth (no pun intended) maritime experience. This allows you to dive to the depths of th eocean and use submarises as well. Some of the things I want to see in Arma 3 are missing such as the ability to take cover behind doors of a vehicle whilst riding in it to avoid being shot easlliy (for example, if you are driving or in the passenger seat of a car you can hold a button to allow you character to switch into 1st person view and duck behind the dashboard and door of the car). Another missing feature is the ability to shoot in vehicles with you character's weapons allowing for military simmulation dirve-bys. My final verdict of Arma 3 is a very solid 8.5 out of 10. Arma 3 offers a very vast and expansive game that has a nearly infinite replayability, yet some of its bugs and optimization hold back Bohemia Interactive's flagship series back once more. If these glitches were to be fixed Arma 3 could be a very famous game that could be a serious threat to games like the Call of Duty franchise or Battlefield franchise as well. Buying this game is a choice you will not regret and with a little time and patience, you can have a blast on this game.

content:
Posted: February 15, 2014
												A realistic Military Simulator, this game is worth a buy. With the ability to create your own missions with the amazing editor and to play others with the in-built workshop support, you can have endless hours of enjoyment with this game. It's quite realistic, but still lacks many features of military warfare that could be put into the game. The graphics ain't so good on my computer but that's because my computer is 8 years old and I will be upgrading soon so I will be able to see this game at it's full potential.This was my first game in the Arma series, followed by Arma 2 (We don't speak of Cold War Assualt). From my experience with Arma 2 this game doen't differ enormously, bar graphics of course. However, it does have some features that are not present in Arma 2, and I frequently notice these features missing when playing Arma 2.If you are new to the Arma series get this game but if you are a long time veteran then maybe wait a little untill you get bored of all the mods on Arma 2.This is a perfect game for any person who enjoys military combat games or would like a realistic simulation of military combat and life. Worth a buy in my opinion.8/10P.S. I haven't played a lot of this game at the current time because it doesn't run so well on my computer and I can only spawn a few units without intense framerate drops.

content:
Posted: October 25, 2014
Great expectations - By Bohemia Interactive. I've been waiting for a demo but this weekend I got the chance to try the game for free. And needless to say, I'm disappointed. ----edit----Needed to add this.The ongoing debate on the forums are mostly about three things.1: Someone who say this game isn't fun or lack content.Replied with: Play with mods!2: Someone who say this game runs poorly on high end systems.Replied with: Tweak your computer!3: The AI is kind of stupid.Replied with: Use missions which script the AI!What I can't understand is why these people accept this and buy the game at full price.When they, by replying as they do, admit and agree the game isn't finished or optimised!Arma 3 Forums*Troubleshooting & bugs	29,45%
Multiplayer & Mods	23,22%
General Discussions	19,71%
Social network & Clans	14,07%
Mission & script edit.	7,75%
Trash bin		5,81%*14-10-27 (YMD)----end edit----Sure everything looks pretty, the humorous dialogues from Arma 2 have been redone and look the soldiers "ragdoll to the ground" when shot! GASP! I didn't like the future take of this with "UH-99^2 Black Shoe" or whatever they were called. That wouldn't have mattered if!The AI could make use of buildings The AI could drive vehicles down a road without swirling off or get stuck in buildings or colliding with each other as they've been doing since Arma 2 The AI could fly aircraft instead of ploughing them into the ground as they've been doing since Arma 2 The AI could fly helicopters in a flight path instead of "ducking" about(increase height when reaching a WP and get shot down by AA) as they've been doing since Arma 2 The AI couldn't see through foliage(grass, bushes etc) as they've been doing since Arma 2 The AI could... etc etc... as they've been doing since Arma 2 Sure, all these things can be scripted to work as expected, but seriously? This game is purely for multiplayer with mods which completely change the game to actually work. I admire the modders who carry on with making the mods to make this game floating, you are the ones who should get paid, not Bohemia! The current state and price of this game is not accepted! What bohemia should have done was to release the graphic engine, script engine and a few vehicles for the modders to use as reference. Then after a while released DLC with more content... Better luck with Arma 4 With a new graphics engine to match. Concentrate on soldier combat Release DLC when new features are working, like AI can fly helicopters and so on.----edit---Oh and don't forget to down vote this review because I think a game should have value and be worth buying!It'll be on sale in a few years, I'll get back then. In the meantime I'll play Arma 2 because with that I have no expectations!----end edit----

content:
Posted: March 19, 2014
												I met up with my friends outside of the airport terminal, we were gearing up for our next mission.There was a shop in the capital of the area that was housing terrorists disguised as refugees, we needed to go in and eliminate all of them.We got our loadouts, set up our radios, and began our journey to the city.When we got there, there were dozens of civilians looking at us crazy, calling people over to see the crazy guys with guns.We found the area and saw the hostiles, unsuspecting, but we knew they were armed, so we opened fire. Down they fell, our M249 PIP was knocking them down like it was nothing.Their reinforcements arived, driving blue cars with blinding lights. We mounted back up in our cars and skidaddled.we got back to the terminal, dumped the gear and cars, debriefed.Then I went home and played ArmA and had a good time.

The DLC are nice-to-have options, but are in no way required to play the game. With over 400h of playtime, it's still a true favorite!

content:
Posted: November 11, 2015
												Arma 3 is probably the best shooter I've ever played.  If you're a COD player, or an active Battlefield player, like I was, this is going to be a huge step for you.  It's a hard game to play, yes, but Bohemia does a great job in giving a comprehensive training course in the virtual reality.  After you get out of virtual reality, enter the world of Altis and Stratis, two Mediterranean islands, most likely off the coast of Greece.  The map size is incredible.  Larger than Skyrim, Fallout 4, and probably The Witcher III put together.  Try running from side to side... just try.  The two islands feature millions and millions of placed objects.  The game ($60 on steam) is totally worth every penny, ESPECIALLY with user-created mods.  Dive into the mods, this game basically becomes invaluable.  Arma 3 truly is an incredible feet of gaming.On the maps - They're huge!  You'll need a vehicle to get around definitely.  Their size is only rivalled by their beauty, if you're playing on ultra high settings it's almost like real life, or at least as close as a game can get.  The country side is not thrown aside in terms of details, actually, it's focused on.  You'll find things such as harbors, wind turbine fields, solar farms, small villages, forests, and rolling plains.   All of these areas are included with immense wildlife, you'll never find yourself alone.  The cities are also well built and great for close quarter combat.  Make sure you download the All in Arma Terrain Pack - this comes with ALL the maps from Arma 2 revamped up to Arma 3 quality.  On the gameplay - It's immenseful.  It's set about 20 yeras in the future.  You'll lose track of time, you'll probably lose your eyesight from getting to close to your PC screen.  Battles are realisticly timed because of the combat system.  You WILL die if you are hit in the head or upper torso, you'll break your legs if you're shot there.  No more rushing into battle or leading to charge, you stick with your team, you'll need them desperately.  You always will have a group of soldiers to command and place, use them to your advantage.  Think of downloading Blastcore, JSRS, and the Enhanced Movement mods, they will decrease your performance slightly, but it's worth the even more realistic feeling.  The battles are HARD.  The United States has been fighting unmathched and outdated opposing forces ever since the end of World War 2.  In this game you are fighting the AAF, a well modernized domestic defense force.  You will also be coming in contact with CSAT, which is basically an army of the Chinese, Russian, and Iranian forces coming together and is very powerful - NATO struggles.  On the weapons - They're almost real to the touch.  The amount of detail that went into these weapons is incredible.  The mechanics are also great.  You'll have to practice recoil management, as well as being able to zero an optic or use the mil-dot system to account for bullet drop.  If you want to make sharpshooting even for difficult/realistic, download the Arma Enhanced Combat mod, now you'll not only have to account for drop, but for wind, and even the rotation of the Earth.  Size matters!  You'll have greater success in hitting a target with a 5.56 and slightly less with the MX's 6.5mm.  Once you get into 7.62 small arms, you'll find a sufficient decrease in accuracy, but better stopping power.  Bullet penetration is a thing, and you will be shot inside a building from the outside if you're not being smart.  Let's also not leave out the insane amount of accessories you cant attach to your weapons, especially if you download some mods.  For example, CUP weapons pack, HLC, RH, etc.  There are great mods out there as always.  On the vehicles - I don't know where to start.  On the ground, you'll usually find yourself rolling in the 2030's MRAP called the Hunter, or a modernized M2A3 Bradley fighting vehicle.  You'll find yourself reinforced by Slammers, the main battle tanks of the future which are vamped up M1 Abrams.  Or even supported by 155mm Howitzers that can even fire laser guided shells.  Go as far as to even be in a Nissan pickup with a .50 cal in the bed.  In the air, you can find yourself in a stealth A-10C, an RAH-66 Commanche, an armed Huey, stealth Blackhawk (the Nighthawk), and Little Bird, fixed-wing UAVs, and even a quadcopter.  Use air support to your advantage!  Even in the sea you'll find yourself in an attack boat or a submersible.  And always, vehicle mods abounds.  REMEMBER - you are fighting modernized military defense forces, they will have everything you have, including hell storms of AA.  Arma 3 is a fantastic game that once you've got the hang of you'll fall in love with.  The community is huge and you'll always find yourself exploring new scenarios and options.  The developers care!  You'll receive weekly or biweekly updates or news items.  Yes, there are bugs.  There are bugs with every game.  With a game this scale, how can you blame them?  They're working on it.  Most of all, explore multiplayer and do scenarios with a group of friends, or maybe 100 friends.  The opportunities are endless, enjoy!

content:
Posted: January 9, 2016
Brief ReviewArma 3 from Bohemia Interactive is the latest in its military simulation series of games, which began with the original Operation Flashpoint: Cold War Crisis. While shipping with a small amount of actual content, that is not what Arma 3 or the Arma franchise is all about. The huge influx of Steam Workshop content, multiplayer and editor make this a full package for the most serious of combat simulator nutsPros and ConsProsNew vehicle physics are greatButterfly shadowsMassive world to explore with lots of potential for long-range engagements (270 km²)Extremely detailed, lush visual presentationHyper-realistic combat will satisfy even the most die-hard sim enthusiastsHuge variety in terms of gameplay scenariosConsControls feel clunkyVery steep learning curveYou will need a new PC (Most likely)An EndingArma as a franchise is class leading at what it does - Military simulation refined and mastered

Posted: April 3, 2016
												This game really is one of the best games I have ever played. Excellent modability and a wonderful community.It started on a small Zeus Community server; there I met someone called Ravenbb, they had their own small group: Coop World Wide (CWW) After playing a few missions, a friend request was sent. This request would eventually lead to the greatest decision I could have made. Joining up in CWW, after a year of just waiting, I finally decided to join. It truly is an amazing group, filled with wonderful and funny people! They've offered a great time, with Ravenbb recreating the entire original Flashpoint campaign. The group itself is just one of many amazing groups you can find. From MilSim, to casual and some inbetween. For me, CWW has created the most fun experience ever in a video game. And even though I have only been a member for 5 months. Many many more fun times are ahead. Ranges of missions that other games jsut can't ever reach. The variety and versitality of all the roles used, from Fighter Pilots, to Tank crews, Helicopter Pilots and even just the normal soldier. Modders have also created some of the most amazing mods out there, it keeps the game fresh and enjoyable. You find a good group like I have, and you will find many many many hours of your life stolen away by great communities.

Posted: June 14, 2015
												ARMA 3 is a tactical based military simulator with many features. You can play alone or in a team, it's entirely up to you.There are many server's that allow various gamemodes - even custom gamemodes and modservers. The choice of many helo's and vehicles of any kind make ARMA 3 immersive and realistic. One of my favourite gamemodes is a roleplay based mode, called Altis Life. There are two main islands in ARMA 3: Altis and Stratis. The goal of Altis Life is making money and interacting with other players. You can also play as a cop or a medic and much more, depending on your taste.

content:

												Still early days for me yet as I am still learning, but what I have seen from this game so far is nothing but awesomeness... VAST LANDSCAPE -  the map is absolutely huge... some players end up having a full time job air lifting people to the hotzone and then back to base and pick up the next lot of soldiers...The GRAPHICS - are absolutely spectacularTHE SOUND - is amazing, really is an immersive experienceREALISM - The most realistic military game I have ever played... if you are a Call of Duty fan... forget it, get out of this page and do not buy this game... You cannot go in guns blazing, you cannot even run from cover to cover without getting puffed out in which causes you to lose accuracy... Battlefield players that feel that Battlefield just doesn't have enough realism, you may appreciate this game as I am an ex-battlefielder and I love this game...THE BAD - Extremely hard... and there are soooo many buttons to remember, but practice makes perfect...9/10 - it loses a point because you cant just pick it up and play, it requires lots of time, practice, patience and discipline.

content:
Posted: March 2, 2016
												Heyyo, hmm... this game runs like♥♥♥♥♥ Heck, even setting my settings on low? I still get really bad framerate dips below 60fps with not a lot of stuff on the screen... I suspect it could be partly due to AMD drivers but reading on forums? NVIDIA users also have bad dips too. It's driving me crazy! Setting the terrain to standard quality and overall view range to 2000 helps... but if there's say 20 units on the screen? My framerate sticks around 35fps which is brutal when Battlefield 4 can handle a lot more players and do it while looking a lot better. I suspect part of it might be because the game only runs in 32bit yet it tries to gobble up RAM as well...I only really bothered with the campaign due to my perfromance woes and it is pretty fun and very challenging and frustrating when the AI decides to randomly hit you with the first bullet or just stares at you blankly as you put them down... same goes for squad mates who randomly stop moving... sigh.I definitely can't recommend this game at the full retail price. I got it on sale and I beat the first campaign section... but I've lost the motivation to finish it unlike ArmA and the older Operation Flashpoint series due to the performance issues. It's driving me crazy when I'm trying to pick a target and my framerate goes all over the scale!My system:Windows 10 Pro 64-bitIntel Core i7 3770K @ 4.40GHz Ivy Bridge 22nm TechnologyCORSAIR Hydro Series H80 (CWCH80) High Performance Liquid CPU Cooler16.0GB (4x4GB) Kingston Dual-Channel DDR3 @ 2133MHz (11-12-11-30 @ 1.65V)Gigabyte Technology Co., Ltd. Z68X-UD7-B3 (Socket 1155 BIOS F11a)ASUS VE278 27" LCD (1920x1080@60Hz via DisplayPort with RGB full)MSI R9 390 Gaming 8G (OC 1120MHz core, 1550MHz mem & +10% power)Creative Labs Sound Blaster Recon3D Fatal1ty Professional PCI-EVisiontek's Bigfoot Network Killer 2100 PCI-E Network Interface CardThermaltake PS-TPD-0850MPCGUS-1 850W 80+ Gold Power Supply[UPDATE1]Before anyone comments that I didn't try tweaking the game? I tried all of the following...I tried the v2 performance client from this thread and it only helped my minimum framerates a bit... http://steamcommunity.com/app/107410/discussions/0/527274088392991283/it definitely didn't fix my average framerate problems when infantrymen are on the screen... which is a serious issue in a first person shooter.I tried downloading the latest AMD Crimson drivers 16.2 and also reverting to Catalyst 15.11.1... no difference...I tried changing my launcher settings for MaxMem to 12288 (3/4 of my 16GB) and 16000 (almost all 16GB) and no difference... game only ever uses about 5.6GB of system memory.I tried changing my maxVRAM to 8192 (8GB of VRAM on my R9 390) and that made no difference.I tried setting my CPU Count to 4 (4 physical cores on an i7-3770k) with exThreads fully checked (same as exThreads =7) and enabled hyper-threading options... no difference.I tried changing my memory allocator to system, tbb4malloc_bi and tbbmalloc... tbbmalloc improved my average framerate by about 10% but still terrible average framerate with four infantrymen on the screen...For the most part? I tried this guide tbh too 


Optimization and Improving FPS 
A Guide for Arma 3
By: >Freak On A Leash.exe

			A Guide for optimizing ArmA 3.		


and that kind-of helped... still doesn't fix framerate when infantrymen are on the screen.I also tried Radeon Pro to force AMD Overdrive to always use highest clocks (my MSI R9 390 Gaming 8G is OC'ed to 1120MHz core, 1550MHz memory and +50 power delivery) and that made barely any difference... maybe 5% better average framerate but still terrible drops with infantrymen on the screen...I tried the "GPU_MaxFramesAhead=" and "GPU_DetectedFramesAhead=" tweaks in the "Arma3.cfg" and that made zero differences too which I suspect acts much like VSYNC.... some games you can fix with tweaking or mods like Dark Souls...... apparently with ArmA 3? It's hit-or-miss if you can fix it, which is INSANE when the asking price is $60 when not on sale... I guess I kinda got my $30 out of it with the 10 hours I got out of the campaign so I paid roughly $3 an hour to play the game... I guess that's still ok but damn I wish this game just didn't run like fecal matter...

content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												Fantastic game. The single player content, showcases and training are good. The real meat of the game is in its multiplayer though. Admittedly, it can be a bit confusing at first if you're a new player, as some servers require you to download mods before you can join the server. There doesn't tend to be a whole lot of "vanilla" servers out there. However, the mods are fantastic and worth the effort, especially if you play them with a group of people.My favorite experience thus far was when we were playing the "Insurgency" mod (military vs terrorists). There's a mod called Task Force Radio, which in a nut shell provides much more realistic radios to use. Each faction has their own encrypted radio, various channels you can switch to and various ranges of radio (long range and short range). As the military, we were attempting to locate intel that was known to exist in a village. A squad was unfortunately KIA, and for the next two hours, the military was getting picked off constantly. I even deployed with a buddy deep into a mountain with full camo, let my team know that where I was and I had good sights on the village, and not 2 minutes later I got sniped even though I was hardly exposed and never took a shot. Later, it turns out they stole a radio off a dead squadmate and were listening to our radio chatter and our positions for 2 hours and we all had a good laugh as the terrorists won.10/10

number of helpful: 6 of 9 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 27, 2014
												The main reason why I bought Arma3 was for the Wasteland mod. I played Arma 2 pretty heavily and I can say for sure that Arma3/Wasteland is far superior than DayZ in every respect except for survival/foraging. I played quite a bit of Arma2 Dayz and I feel that the mod is extremely overrated compared to the other MP experiences Arma has to offer.This review may be more helpful to those who are thinking about the decision to move to Arma3 from Arma2.Arma 3 improves upon Arma 2 in many ways. First it reduces the amount of clutter on the keyboard. Now there isn't (what feels like) fifty keys dedicated to command/radio and now there is more of a streamlined feel to the game. That being said, it's extremely necessary to play with voice, as calling out targets/orders is something that is required in this game, unless you are a lone wolf or you are in a rather large group where the need for such things is lessened.Also, a major update in graphics, which I must say are stunning compared to A2. This doesn't make Arma, but it helps you stay immersed. Needless to say, Arma will always be unoptimized, so please, learn simple optimization tricks before giving up after seeing you have <30 frames. It's worth it.The amount of customizations in this game is extremely helpful/useful. Be warned though, it may take some time before you get the hang of it as Arma, being buggy, has a tendency to make things hard. Plus there's the fact that sometimes a player can get their hands on a fantastic sniper rifle, minus the scope (I'm pointing at you wasteland). So be warned of these situations before you find yourself in one that isn't to your liking.After all of this I would suggest that people with lower end computers don't buy this game or be prepared to run it on low settings. But the low settings are nothing to be mad about, as they are still pretty damn good, and graphics are not something that you come to Arma for in the first place.Now for those who haven't experienced the Military Sim feels (you know what I'm talking about)... Arma. Delivers.When played right, it delivers a deep comradery that cannot be gotten from most other games on the market. When you achieve something with your friends, who you sometimes have to place 100% trust in, it can be awe inspiring and can lead to many ecstatic shouts over the radio for doing something seemingly insignificant if seen through eyes of a standard FPS player.Now about gameplay; Arma requires an extreme amount of patience. Normally you have one or two rounds of fire to get things right or you will be sent to the death screen. Bullets hurt. Really bad. Normally getting hit with one is life threatening if it's normal caliber, but any more than that and you could be facing a bit of a journey back. This normally means 10-20 minutes to regroup and find another battle worth fighting. But don't worry, many of my fondest memories of Arma are from moments that are just random and unexpected, and they don't even require the slightest trace of enemy presence.( http://i.imgur.com/GgapTFX.jpg ) <- From Arma2TL;DRArma 3 is a much improved upon Arma 2, nothing extremely new here but there's still quite a bit more which makes it worth getting if your computer can handle the game and you can handle the buggyness/playstyle of Arma. It is one of my favorite games and is the leader of its genre, and rightfully so.For those wondering approximately 300 hours of game time logged on Arma2.

content:
Posted: January 11, 2014
												Carrying on from the genre-defining MilSim that was Arma 2, Arma 3 is a rock solid sequel that lives up to the expectations in place for the Arma series, even managing to go a bit beyond in certain aspects. As a great fan of Arma 2, I love Arma 3 and the improvements BI have managed to implement into the game. As well as showing off near-future battlefield tech in the game to help accurately represent the game's time period, BI have also managed to develop great maps, interesting gamemodes (Wasteland) for online play, and still manage to maintain and improve upon the fun level of realism that made Arma 2 so popular with MilSim players. The modding scene is also very active, with mods such as ACE and ACRE out there for added realism and more 'serious' MilSim players which allows the game to be expanded upon a lot. Be warned however, the game isn't shy on performance and requires a decent rig to run properly even on mid-range settings. My only major whine about the game itself is the developer's choice to release the campaign in a series of 'episodes', drip-feeding us content and missions. But as each episode is released, this negative becomes less and less of a factor. I'm giving Arma 3 a 9/10, and deffinitely recommend this game.

content:
Posted: May 4, 2014
												They fixed fatigue and a worth while DLC is on the way. Who died and took over?-----------------------------------[Fatigue Update]This has ruined the game. I'm not even exagerating. Unless you only use vehicles 24/7 this update will have ruined the game for you, making you aim like a drunkard after jogging about all of 10m and forcing you to walk at a snails pace after a whole 20m. That's some ♥♥♥♥ing wonderful realism, isn't it guys.-----------------------------------If I had to compare Arma 3 to another game, I'd say its the grandchild of Battlefield and Skyrim. With massive-scale combat, maps that dwarf any other shooter without question, and a variety of user-made game modes along with the vanilla series of Zeus game modes there is no shortage of content. In the recently added Zeus modes you can even turn this first-person shooter into an RTS game.The game mechanics are mostly solid however some minor things such as falling damage, parachute mechanics, and cars/trucks turning to useless wrecks after a realtively minor bump into anything leave plenty of room for improvement. Bugs are also still a signifigant issue, even to the point of causing some destroyed buildings to randomly shoot someone into the air and have them fall to their death. And in general, the engine feels stiff.Much like Skyrim—issues asside, if you find the right game mode for you, almost anyone should be able to find some enjoyment out of Arma 3. Whether you're some hardcore-roleplaying type, want to fight for survival all over an island, or simply want to vie for control over a city; there is plenty to do.

number of helpful: 6 of 9 people (67%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 1, 2015
												Spending enough time in this game to fully appreciate the good and the bad, I have decided to put some words down.  I love this game more than any other game that comes to mind.Where do I start?  I'll start with the hard stuff.You will stuggle with this game.  You will have moments where you hate the way it's coded.  You will die to stupid things, like stairs or rocks.  You will hate the fatigue system and the weapon sway. You will get annoyed at the reskins for outfits.Eventually, you will mod it.This is not a simple run and gun game.  You will not find yourself 'no scoping' after sprinting for 2 kliks.  Arma 3 is a simulator first and a game second.  The groundwork is solid for the most part.  The modding community is devoted.  The game modes are varied.  There is something that almost everyone will find appealing inside this package.Halo jumping dressed like the UK Special Forces? Check.  Thank a modder.Driving a hatchback that's colored like the American flag? Check. Thank a modder.Want to build a mission around the Tet Offensive? Check. Thank a modder.Am I biased? Yes. Do I have a huge amount of respect for modders? Yes.Arma 3 is a cpu intensive game.  You will have to tweek the hell out of it to make it just right.  You aren't going to get 60 fps on poorly coded MP servers. Please don't think it's your hardware, it's not.  Well, probably not.But this game really shines in the graphic department once she's setup just right.  I'm constantly trying to squeeze as much performance as possible, but I'm not going to go over everything I've done, it would take too long.  If you google it, you will find it.Playing the game by yourself is hindering your fun to an extent I can't even explain.  Ok, since you asked so nicely, I'll try.Playing to campaign alone left me yearning for more.  I really disliked the interface when assigning targets, or handing out orders to the AI squadmates I had been shackled with.  It doesn't feel very fluid, nor does it give me the feeling of teamwork.  The AI, at times, can go 'full retard' and just stand there while being mowed down by the enemy forces.  You may order them to get into the truck you're sitting in, only to find one of them has the great idea to run right into the AO and alert everyone to your presence.  Ok, I guess stealth is off the table.  At least I have superior numbers?  Ha, they won't get out of the truck and that rpg is headed this way.  I'll just reload my save then.Now, replay that with real people that communicate and know how to play.  Completely different outcome.  I'm not typing that hypothetical situation out again, just trust me.Now, onto the really fun part.  That part that makes my genitals tingle.  The Mods.OMG Becky, look at those mods.  They're so big!No, they aren't all large downloads.  Even some of the smallest mods can change the game to a large extent.Take AGM for example.  It has different frag throwing options. A medical system that includes epi's, blood bags, adrenaline and the ability to drag people to safety.  No longer can you see how many rounds are left in your mag, you can only 'see' the weight.  It has weapon resting, fast roping, cook offs, vehicle repair options and a bunch of other things I can't think off.What about vehicles?  I really like the hummvees from Arma 2.  There are a few different options for mods for that.Do you hate that you stop moving when you switch weapons?  There's a mod for that.Tactical glasses have no use in the game? There's a mod that gives you a hud when wearing the glasses in first person.I hate the stock sounds. JSRS3 baby!Want a Canadian mohawk?  Reskin mod.Tired of playing Altis or Stratis?  Bornholm, Tilos, Chernobyl, Chernarus, Utes, Panthera. Just to name a few of the many user made maps available with a few clicks.Be warned.Mods don't always work 'right out of the box™'.  If you don't have patience, you're just going to have a bad time.  Sometimes mods don't work well with each other, or give you graphical errors, or aren't compatible with user made missons.  In short, when they work, oh baby do they. When they don't, you deal with it or stop using them.Look, I'm biased.  I really am.  I love the milsim aspect of this game.  I love the squad play.  I love the vehicles and the guns. I love the guys I play with.They say that the best things in life are the things you have to work for.  That's what Arma 3 is.You have to work for it.  But it really shines in the long run.

												Mechanically, Arma 3 is outstanding, with controls that are smooth while still portraying the weight of a human body. Weapons feel great and firefights remain intense both against AI and other humas. Atlis is an impressive map with each square kilometer offering interesting options for firefights. It also happens to be the best looking open world game around in terms of sheer realism. I'm genuinely excited to see how this game develops in the coming years.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												I played this game back when it was the free game for the weekend. I never purchased it afterwards, and you'll probably figure out why from both my review and those of others. So, as anyone could reasonably expect, I was pretty excited for this game to be free for the weekend, as I've had my eye on it for almost a year! As an avid ARMA II fan, I had always been a little dissapointed with the lack of more modern military tech in an otherwise great game. I thought ARMA 3 would whisk all my problems away and carry me into ARMA heaven. It didn't quite work out like that though...So upon launch the first thing that struck me as odd was the lack of info. Sure, the menus are much more appealing to the eye, but the tutorials were some weird lovechild of a campaign and a quest-system. It was very strange, so much so that I neglected to finish the first one. "Oh well," I thought. "I've played enough ARMA II to figure out how to handle myself."And for the most part I was right. I jumped into the campaign and it was fun! So why the negative review? Well, the campaign was fun for a little bit, but after that 'new game smell' wore off, it wasn't much to brag about. I moved on, and played some tank match which I can't remember too many details about, other than a few key things. First off, everything was insanely grey. Now I understand the use of dynamic lighting and warzone fog and stuff like that, but this was just rediculous. So, as I was cruising around with my platoon of Slammers, we encountered some enemies! Great! Let's see how this works! So to sum that up, there's unique and dynamic damaged/dead unit models depending on their style of demise, the radio chatter no longer sounds like a panicking android but a much cleaner soldier, and vehicle control is no longer a reinactment of the mountain scene in Tokyo Drift.But, what I couldn't get over was the lack of diversity. Oh look, Slammers. Hey, more slammers. Oh, a Wolverine (I think). And OMG another slammer. What I'm getting at is that, unlike its predicessor, ARMA 3 has no vast, game-changing DLCs (other than Karts, but that isn't even military.) So what you end up with is this massive tropical island turned warzone, and you get the same handful of units over and over, which might not matter for AIs, but for myself I prefer a diverse choice in my vehicles and other wartime equipment. Sure, it's modable, but so was ARMA II, and I already know the cool mods for that, which totally redefine the feel of the game.So, over all:+Better lighting and physics+Better voices and immersion+Diverse factions+Newer tech to toy around with-Low diversity of units-Poor tutorials for those who want to start at the top-Modernized EVERYTHING, even when unnecessary (e.g. Hummingbirds. It's such a pointles change, just give me my Little Bird!!)-Virtually no DLCs that expand the battle experience, and the ones that exist aren't worth the cost for the amount of units recieved-Essentially a more stabil version of a modded ARMA II clientOverall, I would just reccomend saving the money for other stuff, there's plenty of games on steam, but none of them, not even ARMA 3, can match the charm and pure flexibility of ARMA II.

content:
Posted: January 2, 2015
												I originally bought Arma when it first came onto steam. However back then I only played 1-2 hours of it, and left it in my library to rot. It was not only until a week or two ago when I started to play it fully. I tried out most gamemodes, and I must say, it is a great game. Below is (a long) first match.I jumped into a King of the Hill match, and it was hectic. People were shouting over coms, team and proximity chat, strategitcal locations and manuevers. The objective was 3 Km away so everyone at the base was finding transport anyway they could. I found this small helicopter almost full taking off, I hopped in and we flew away.The pilot, attempting to avoid fire and a long flight, flew over the deep ocean. Now we weren't that far from shore, but far enought that it would be an insanely long swim. I was sitting in the middle of the helicopter looking at the pilot, as he looked back and told me it would only be a couple minutes, and that we would have to parachute. As he looked back at me, I could see through the windshield a missle coming right towards us. There was an enemy hidden on the shore with a rocket launcher. We were hit and falling at a rapid rate. The launcher hit our back tail, and we were plummiting towards the ocean. Fumbling with my keys to try to jump out, the helicopter hit the water, and sank extremely fast. I was lucky enough to eject myself, and swim towards the surface. As I swam I saw several bodies of the other passengers. I was the only survivor. Hurt from the crash, I was unable to swim fast, and I was stuck in the middle of the ocean. The waves were big so I had to fight staying on the surface. I was about to give up hope and drown myself, as I knew I wouldn't make the swim. All of sudden I hear a helicopter! Some pilot saw the crash and saw me swimming! He lowered himself and I hopped in. Boy was I glad, I thanked him a ton, and we started to fly off as I saw the bodies of my comrades float to the surface. I was able to capture a picture of the rescue below. (I play on three monitors so excuse the extremely wide screenshot)


Water Rescue 
A Screenshot of Arma 3
By: Nick Gurr




Sadly this rescue would end soon as the same rocket launcher shot us down for good. I spawned back at base and rode out on an ATV with some random teammate on the back. The drive was long, 3 Km, and towards the end, a helicopter lowered down and shot rockets at us. It had come from nowhere. As it hit us with one rocket, a friendly jet shot it down. Hurt from the rocket, my teammate and I escaped into the bushes. We were still 500 meters from the objective. Moving at an extremely slow rate because of the injuries, we ran into battle. Sadly we were both easily picked off. My 30 minutes thus far has been a failure to go into actual battle, and I wanted to actually fight for once. I rode on a helicopter and we parachuted down, all 12 of us. People shot up as us as I saw a few friends fall, I flew into a tree and hid in some bushes. An enemy tank and some infantry walked right past me as I lay in the bushes. Once they left, I ran into a broken down house with half of it missing. I look out a window and see a dozen enemy troops parachuting down.. into the backyard. None of them saw me but I knew once I started firing, I was to be outnumbered. Desperate for some firefight, I opened fire. 1..2...3...4... they all fell as I shot them down. More men had landed but they were confused where I was firing from. I had killed 4 men at this point and killed a 5th as I looked to my left to see a sniper in the bushes. Him and I stared at each other for a few seconds, as I saw him aim down his sights, and headshot me.Seriously 9/10 great game. Only reason not a 10 is because of some bugs and poor optimization on some servers. This game isn't for a casual person looking for some quick action, you should know what you're doing or else people will yell at you.Too much water -IGN

number of helpful: 7 of 11 people (64%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 23, 2015
												Campaign is awful. I understand that only giving you one user save per mission makes you rely on being smart about how you approach certain objectives, but when your ally AI are dumber than rocks, it makes things really difficult, and almost impossible in some instances. I understand they might not be programmed to know how to clear a room, or use bounding to move up, but it would be nice if when I order them to move 100m front to cover they would do that as opposed to moving backwards 300m and laying in the prone. Also, when you are assaulting an objective 200m in front of you, and you give them specific targets to shoot, they instead choose to engage the two guys on the opposite mountain 500m away. Lets also not forget what I'm assuming is a bug where even after clearing an area, they refuse to move in anything other than a low crawl (makes it difficult when your next objective is 500m away) I wanted a game where the idea wasn't you have to do everything by yourself, but obviously thats not the case. In addition to crappy AI, there are other bugs that make the game absolutely miserable. When attacking a lookout tower you can shoot the guy in the head a couple times, toss 3 grenades into it, and yet if you get within 10m of it, an enemy laying in the prone up there will phase his gun through the floor and kill you before you even try to move into it and clear it. If those bugs were fixed, it would actually be an enjoyable game, but having to restart from the last checkpoint where you have to walk 15 min to the next area only to get killed by a glitch gets really old really fast.
