content:
Posted: February 22, 2015
												There is a notion of this game i can't figure out. This game is an all around mess and an all around success in all aspects. Many call it a finished product and a BLAST to play and some call it an unplayable mess which involves complete "hyper realistic fails". So who is right? Well, this game appeals to both an arcade style audience willing to get action and combat at extreme levels and also to the hardened clan fighting veteran focused on mods which improve gameplay and add features to the game to improve and keep game experiences fresh. In this game however, having played it for solid hours on end, these moments which I had did not come naturally. For a game to acheive its scale and realism to levels as in ARMA 3 is by no means accepted to all in this generation. Not trying to put my old man cap on here but to play games like DayZ and ARMA you can't expect double kills and planes and cars to appear at the spawn. The PMC's of advanced warfare didn't appear in the army for just being strong and chosen. To play ARMA, it is the same as DayZ (although not as boring) and all "running simulators". And I don't mean to scare you by saying to have to run to Pygros from Kavala with broken legs. What I mean is the same principle that you DON'T start as a badass, and if that is your playstyle just don't play it or convince yourself that you can take the heat. Stories have to be made with extreme disiplinary acts in this game. And how do you get those? Well here are the steps. 1. THIS GAME TAKES SOME ♥♥♥♥ING BALLS TO GET WHERE YOU NEED TO GO. This can always be avoided (LOL not really) some way or another through the vast expanse of gamemodes like wasteland, and joining a realsim unit is all acceptable for even the hardest MLG sniper to learn what this game is about. But  this part cannot be let go. In parts where the game is about serious progression, you CAN'T be the one crying for someone to give you a chance because you are being a little ♥♥♥♥♥ cat. To be the general, you gotta go through West Point first. 2. THIS GAME WILL BRING YOU DOWN TO YOUR ♥♥♥♥ING KNEES AND WILL ALWAYS ♥♥♥♥ WITH YOU. So, how do not let this happen? Well you really ♥♥♥♥ING can't. It all happens in a matter where if you are in the right place at the right time which perfectly demonstrates how this game IS SUPPOSED TO BE. This is why you need to be with a team of people who know what they are doing and know exactly WHAT THE HELL is going on, or be daring and be alone, being a target, and dying. Just like in an animal world. So treat it like that. Hunt or be hunted, kill or be killed, the strong only survive. Because this is no FPS that you have ever seen and before buying this, you have to know what is coming for your soul.Oh, but I have decided to roast your♥♥♥♥♥again by saying that this game is amazing fun. "Oh, but you said it took a long time and was boring." 3. SHUT THE HELL UP AND LISTEN TO ME. Because if you don't you will die. This game, has changed my perspective on what it is. Well, what is this game? What does it offer? What are you in for? To be honest, this game is really a test of mentality. This game is really to see what you do in dire situations of disaster, catastrophe,  military occupation, and survival. This can tie in to thinking of this game as an animal world like I said before. To live, you have to be familiar with your surroundings, familiar with the weapons, and all around just knowing WHAT THE ♥♥♥♥ YOU ARE DOING. Because this game is never merciful and is always working against you as said in my other steps above. So how can you alter this? You can't. You can't change the future. You can't CHANGE your actions in this game.Because it defeats the whole purpose.

number of helpful: 66 of 126 people (52%) found this review helpful7 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 2, 2015
												Mixed feelings for Multiplayer. #1 - Game is fun and the gametype elements are pretty cool. You have one big city with surrounding area and a designated landing zone. Three teams fly and drive their troops close to the LZ and try and take 4-5 tower areas within the LZ. Makes for a lot of fun building to building fighting but likewise can choose to sit and wait or snipe outside of the LZ. It's one of a few game modes (King of the Hill).#2 - The gaming engine for multiplayer is super buggy. EXPECT to have between 15-30 frames AT BEST. If you have an i5/i7, you'll do better. If you have an AMD prepare for the hurt. It does NOT matter about your video card or ram(I have a GTX 980  and 32GB of RAM and get around 15-25 frames). The game is CPU intensive. Actually this isn't the proper wording. It's a serious flaw that the game is CPU intensive rather than GPU intensive.Everyone will say "well upgrade your CPU". Ok Ok, I could but a guy I play with (no joke) has a dual i7, 3 titan video cards and 128MB of ram and he still sometimes drops below 20 and never over 35ish on average. Sometimes it's ok to play othertimes it's just too damn stupid. Server syncs are sometimes really choppy. It's actually really sad that for $59.99 (about the most expensive a PC game gets these days) that it has these types of issues. Then once in game about 1/2 the guns, scopes, vehicles and others they want you to pay more for. I find myself many times having to sit back and not play the way I want to but rather the way I know I can shoot and kill people because of FPS issues. Most I can say is that they did not build this game with the intention of having huge multiplayer battles. If the gameplay type wasn't superb no one would put up with this serious flaw. No joke. 15-20 frames the average person will have ....nearly unacceptable for the price paid if solely intend on multiplayer. 10/10 if it was built for large world multiplayer in mind. Unfortunatly, it's not so I'll rate it a 6.5/10

No thanks.)If you'd compare ARK: Survival Evolved to ArmA 3, you'd not be able to imagine why ArmA 3 is such a damned money burden compared to FREE updates and Steam Workshop based content that actually gets added into the MAIN GAME instead of copied by the lazy af devs and charged money for instead.Don't get me wrong though, ArmA 3 is a great game, with just around over 9000 exceptions including optimization and overpriced content (wtf even Battlefield premium is cheaper, and you get ♥♥♥♥ing 7 new maps added in? yeah right Bohemia).(I mean it would be worth it if my GTX 980 Ti OC+, i5 4690K, 16 GB RAM COULD ACTUALLY PERFORM WELL ON ARMA 3)Max cap: 60 FPS, lowest cap: 2 FPS. AVERAGE CAP: 5 - 40 FPS - Depending if ArmA 3 likes your PC build or is NOT optimized for it.My suggestion: Avoid, if NOT on SALE, or buy from a keystore to avoid supporting devs like a boss, same goes for Apex.(I've played over 1k hours in total, this isn't my main acc though :D)

number of helpful: 31 of 58 people (53%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 10, 2014
												Poor edition to the Armaverse. Tons and tons of potential that is being sadly wasted. The game has nice graphics and lighting albeit not Dx11. The main island Altis, looks quite impressive indeed but has a very empty feeling and doesnt feel alive like other arma maps did. The ragdoll which is one of the new features feels half finished, like the rest of this game if I'm honest. An example of this is all static 50cals have the same model and this situation you will see through out the game, the latest content added were reskined with slight model change BAF helicopter and vehicle which is unacceptable in book if you already payed for that content if you bought BAF for arma 2.The sound leaves very little to be desired, with clipping audio and samples so loud that they actually break up (tank main guns). ArmA and ArmA2 have infinitely better programmed sound engines. ArmA3 is currently a dead duck in my opinion, anything that is positive about this game is quickly over shadowed by lack of content, bugs, inconsistances in code and I hate to say it but, bordom. I never thought I'd hear myself saying it but yes, this game is boring.With the pace of the games meaningful development slower than a snail I'd venture to say dont expect much soon.Maybe if the game still lives in 2015 it could be great, but right now it is certainly not that. Only time will tell if BIS take advantage of this games potentials. My feeling is that it will fall by the wayside because of lost potential and lack of real core code bug fixes.

												CoD players; Our game is very tactical, while screaming 360 no scope.Battlefield players; phuh our game is very realistic with big maps, while jumping out of a jet to pistol down another jet.Me in Arma; After sneaking around for 15min I got shot while hiding behind a bush when I met my first enemy... for the 20th time. AND I LOVE IT. Keeps me from signing up in the military.I can't spend 45 euro/dollar on a single game and I won't spend it on this game but in contrast to most games. This game is really worth it if you have the money.Pro:-extreme modding tools/editor (== many mods)-campaign is the realism I have been looking for (subjective)-vast visual improvement versus Arma2 (and ran very well with me)-much better controls versus Arma2-Zeus is a vast content addition for strategy lovers-perfect for lan parties-huge amount of contentCon: (nitpicking)-Armory? Where is it!-nvidia physX... sorry amd-lacking fully destructible environment-sometimes horrendous multiplayer community-vehicle physics still need improvement-call me annoying but this game needs many more vehicles-action menu still needs improvement-multiplayer can be very laggy-Arma without bugs is not Arma-noob unfriendly UI/controls etc (or is that a pro?)

content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												So where do I start!! Review is below please read all before passing judgement :)I'm so so so disappointed :( I bought a PC again after a massive 8 year PC break when I moved to console in very late 2006 . I bought an Xbox 360 which I owned for almost 6 years then only 13months ago I moved too XBox One had it for 4 months and thought get rid of this piece of junk and use the money  I get and put it towards a new Gaming PC so june this year (2014) I bought a PC. Anyway so I bought a PC with one thing in my mind "Yes it will be like the old days I will join back up with my clan" I was with almost 7 years ago. I enjoyed countless hours days weeks years with the lads on Operation Flashpoint : Cold War, Arma and then Arma 2. I was in the AirCorps for them "GOL" clan they are called so I signed up for them cause I forgot my password (come on its been 7 years ago) and used the same name as I was back in 2006 ish 'GOL Tactical' I thought wow its been that long I was wiped from there system :) Anyway LT Chris didnt know how I was so I mentioned a few names to him and that were old clan memebers and he stopped talking for a split second "are its you Bloody knife" (which was my original name before changing to GOL Clan when I )was expected) The guy that made me start an AirCorps. I was so excited to be back sadly most of the old memebers werent around (god I sound like a child Im' 25).Sorry for all the text above :) I just wanted you/people to know that I've played Arma before for alot longer than most 7 years straight. I bet most reading this didnt know about Operation Flashpoint was originally part of the same team that is today currently making Amra still  today. Anyway present day 30/12/2014The ReviewI'm sorry but the Arma I grew up to love is just not the same Arma! Arma 3 is like to me the Call Of Duty of today every childs dream, its the game that they must have otherwise your not cool etc although that last statment isn't true for Arma franchise it only came extemely popular in like 2007 to early 2008. Thats how much I love or sould I say loved Arma it was my goto game whenever I was bored I would talk about Arma when I was at school when I was with anyone, as soon as I got in Lets play Arma whenever I had spare time Lets Play Arma I even bunked/skipped days of school to play more. I just didnt get bored of Arma or Arma 2 or Operation Flashpoint Cold Assault if I'm honest it consumed all of my early teens and into my late teens. Yes a full 7 years of my lifeI was coming up to be 19 and on my birthday I bought a Xboxb 360, go and read the above for a full discription :)So the Arma I knew was a realistic military simulator the best simulator infact but Arma 3 what have you done you've gone slightly futurisitc. Why? Its a military sim how can you simulate something that isnt even made yet keep it with the real life stuff that is used today you at least in my eyes have ruined my childhood game thanks Bohemia Interactive and 555 games thanks a bunch. It isnt all bad though its just because of my history with the game as you can tell they are many happy customers giving good reviews. But if Arma 1 and 2 and 2.5 is anything to go by hopefully they are modders out there that feel the same way as me and remove all the futuristic stuff and replace with Real Equipment Weapons etc that are used todayIf you got this far thanks for reading and dont base the game of my review its just because of my history with the game. The core components are there with what I can assume is realistic simulation its just not me furturisitc stuff in a Simulator you cant call it a sim in my eyes anyway. So as you can tell I dont recommend this game. Even the it almost hurts to say it : (

												Sometimes i just wonder what the developers did except creating the very basic of this game, let me remind you.First of all this is not a solo game at all this is pure multiplay game, but dont get excited because you are under the 3rd parties servers rules, and this is not bad actually some of them are really amazing people and i met alot, the point is there is no progress can be build in this game, and all your data will be removed after few weeks of playing in 75% of the servers.2nd if you are planning the build a base with your team then you are wasting your time, there is no way to keep it except if you know the server admin,3rd the weak health  logarithm in the game, and dying from things don't make sense while it is an extremely survivor game, after you gather all your stuff which can take you 1 hour at least.4th having fun in the game takes a lot of time to start, you need at least 4 hours if you decided to have a short gameplay and maybe kill 10 people if you were lucky.5th the rain really makes you crazy, it is lines and lines everywhere, i mean if it is a simulation game,they should conseder that rain doesn't look like lines, i live in a very rainy area and when it rains yes we can't see clearly and far , but not white lines and lines.6th the cheat and the endless ways to do that while they even have an anti cheat system called (BATTLEYE), such i huge name for cute and stupid function.7th everything in here is about huge names, SIMULATION , MILITARY , SURVIVOR, TACTICAL , REALISTIC !? since when if i have to switch weapons the player will stop moving ?? 8th have you ever asked what is the differences between tank and the other type of tank? Posted: March 20, 2014
												Arma 3 enhances on the Arma 2 experience by running better and expanding on features to make it a lot more of a smooth experience. With Arma 2 movement was clunky and sometimes that could have gotten you killed in a firefight because you couldn't get in cover because of the really bad control scheme, however with Arma 3 that is fixed with the stances system. The vehicles of Arma 3 are a lot better than Arma 2, it works. I can't wait until mods like ACE are released on Arma 3 expanding on the experience even more. It's well worth the price. Although the content is slightly lacking, the game expands on Arma 2 loads and I'm sure an expansion pack like Operation Arrowhead will appear for Arma 3 aswell.Buy it, well worth it.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 1, 2014
												This is definitely one of the hardest games i have played, i mean, i tried the first mission +30 times on easy and never survived the first encounter with the enemy. I had to find a cheat just to get past the the first battle, but the next was just as hard. I don't think Dark Souls is this hard, and it gets worse as you progress.One annoying thing is when your character gets fatigued from running he starts to pant harder than a vintage German porn flick, i guess NATO must have lowered the standards in 2035. He'll start panting after ~30 meter and it gets worse if you continue to run, even walking makes him sound like he a heavy smoker with Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. But don't let the single player main campaign scare you from buying the game, you can have much more fun with the editor. It takes some time to figure it out, but you can make really good missions with it. The graphics is good, but you need a very powerful PC to play it with high settings. The FPS is showing when you do the changes so you don't have to exit the menu to test it. A joystick is recommended for flying the planes and helicopters.The game have a good variety of weapons, equipment and vehicles. The ballistics add a touch of realism.

content:
Posted: October 7, 2015
												Get 2-3 friends. Play this game. Get some mods. Rinse and repeat. Pros: Two maps with HUNDREDS of locations simulating miles and miles of fully accessable openworld.No two operations are going to be the same. Sandbox with diverse weapons for infanty.Vehicals including multiple variants of cars, trucks, APCs, tanks, helicopters and fixed wing aircraft. Active moding community to adjust everything including core gameplay, adding new maps/locations, enhanced medical systems, and more.  Bouts of boredom and anticipation followed by intense, heartpounding combat. Its the only game where my friends and I can talk about specific firefights we fought together and actually remember what we are talking about. Cons: Enemy AI in the base game is insanely accurate. Often able to hit targets over half a kilometer away with ironsights on an SMG. This is fixed with mods like "bCombat", or by careful editing of text files. High system requirements, (you are usually lucky to get 45fps on a server). There are loads of guides online to maximize your performance, but the game is just so big that the processing power required is going to slow down the game. That being said a friend of mine can run it on a gaming laptop, so you don't need to be ridiculously high end, just dont expect a perfect 60fps experience even on a thousand dollar PC.

content:
Posted: March 2
												Arma 3 is a very good game.I think it is worth the money, even for the DLC's. Arma is a Military Simulator, Sandbox, First Person/Third Person Shooter.It is not like the average First Person Shooter, and some would probably say it requires a lot of skill. As well as being  Arguably  realistic, it can be quite a challenge to learn. There are many different keybindings, controls and settings to learn, so it can take quite a while before you get the hang of it. Singleplayer: - The campaign is quite enjoyable, all the while teaching you controls and game mechanics. - You can also mess around in the editor and make different scenarios and test vehicles/weapons- Firing drills for working on aim and coordination- Workshop Maps for playing on- Weapon + Vehicle testing in  Virtual Arsenal and Garage  Multiplayer: In my opinion, it is fun to play with friends because you can do things like: - Co-Op missions and scenarios- Working together in a certain vehicle (Gunner, Pilot)- Even just playing on an online server together- You can make your own server to play with friends or even by yourself Settings and Game Mechanics - You can toggle between First Person and Third Person- A lot of vehicles (Air/Land/Sea)- A lot of weapons (Assault Rifles/Snipers/Pistols/Rocket Launchers/PDW/Carbine/SMG's)- Cool Maps and Mods to download from the workshop- Great graphics - HUD Customisation- Customisable Keybinds- Controller Support  Pros and Cons   Pros: - A lot of gamemodes, missions scenarios to play on- Great Multiplayer and Singleplayer options- Good graphics- Controller Support- A lot of different weapons and vehicles to play with- Virtual Arsenal and Garage to test vehicles and weapons- Toggleable First and Third Person- Customisable Hud and Keybinds Cons: - Might be a little on the expensive side, especially with DLC's- To run it, you need a decent computer- Doesn't use your PC's Specs to its full ability- Only for Windows (Mac users are probably used to it anyway)- Quite a tight learning curveOverall, I think  Arma 3  is a great game and is worth the money for it and it's DLC's.

												It may look like "Hardcore millitary simulator" for someone, but actually, it has nothing to do with realism and simulation. Singleplayer campaign is sometimes frustrating, thanks to the stupid AI, but its not bad. Great thing is the new Eden Editor, where you can make your own scenarios, or just do funny stuff. But the real deal stands in Multiplayer, where you can choose from normal casual conflicts, to organizations/clans and MILSIM simualtions. The realism in vanilla game is almost like Battlefield, with little more options, but more laggy and unoptimized (Engine from 2001?). Irrespective of the LAZINESS from Bohemia Interactive. (example is the new Apex Expansion) Really small amount of Units/Factions and Weapons/Gear, so i highly recommend using mods. Overall I do recommend buying Arma III, if you have NASA PC and you're big fan of more open military action.

content:
Posted: February 20, 2014
												ArmA 3 (Armed Assault 3) is definitely the most graphically and mechanically impressive title so far in the ArmA series. However - despite it being "released", there is still a heafty amount of bugs and glitches in the game, although they may be small and more in the background than presented upfront. There are also more optimizations that could definitely be implimented that would fix its problem with inconsistant (few and far between but are still issues) crashes happening during multiplayer experiences. These issues have lead a number of users, both old and new, to see ArmA 3 as still being in beta developement.That will ultimately be left up to you to decide though.Besides these issues though, ArmA 3 has advanced from its previous titles in terms of an updated and continuously polished physics engine, numerous graphical improvements to drive immersion, new mechanical upgrades allowing more in-depth maneuvering in either land, see or air vehicles as well as hoofing it across the battlefield and already developing expansions to add more content to the game. (Zeus game mode) Bohemia Interactive are definitely heading in the right direction withthis title, giving it all the love and attention they can muster and, in my opinion, doing the best they seem to be able to do as they're still defined as an independent developer.Pushing onwards from their previous flagship; ArmA 2, BI so blatently wants their entire fanbase, present and future, new and old to be able to take away and share the same amazing experiences from ArmA 3 as they did from the previous titles. And making way to provide great enjoyment for said fanbase which consists of diehard veteran players and their amazing moding community which has put out vanilla content-worthy additions to past titles as well as already ArmA 3.Being new to the series as of the official beta of ArmA 3, I've gone back to ArmA 2 to see where ArmA 3 is coming from. Even though A3 is considered by some to still be an unfinished product despite being released with a pricetag of $60, I can see that my investment will be paying off sooner or later. However I spent $45 when it was still in beta. So you may have to look harder if you've only recently purchased it.

content:
Posted: March 2, 2014
												One of the best mil-sim ever produced. It offers a great variety of units, vehicles, weapons and environmental diversity. The best part, still the modding community and the Arma III Editor, literally endless. You can create at will, modify, script it, doesn't matter, if you want, YOU CAN DO IT. Ballistics and Physics have improved astonishingly, the animations are fluid and you can feel it's verisimilitude. If you're a seasoned ArmA veteran, you'll definitely love this game, you'll find everything you already know and a whole new scale of possibilities and AWESOMENESS. If you're new to the ArmA Series, you, like everyone else, will go through a very steep learning curve, you'll find yourself having troubles running, walking, aiming, shooting, driving, flying, planning and pretty much any activity you're about to perform. but don't give up just yet, I can assure you, if you're a fan of mil-sim, you'll love it and it'll come to life. The game is pretty much awesome, but it'll really come to life once you find a couple of friends to play with! Good Luck! See you in Altis!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 16, 2014
												Having bought this on day one, I do not regret it. I'll start with the gun play. Small arms feel weak against anyone wearing a vest, taking more than two shots to kill sometimes even with the almighty 7.62. However, if you play a scenario without body armor of any kind you should have a deadlier match. While I wish BI would fix the problem themselves, the Authentic Gameplay mod seems to help, or at least it makes me wanna go back to an Arma 3 firefight. Driving vehicles feels a lot smoother than Arma 2 in my opinion, thanks to PhysX. A lot of it is still off though, for example, the karts turn ridiculously fast. It's no GTA IV in the driving department, but it's clear they're making improvements over past installments in this department. Sounds are... acceptable. It's clear why sound mods are always so popular for the Arma series. They smoothened out the dialogue, but gun sounds sound weaker and quieter, though they can still be heard from some distance. The campaign is good improvement over the past, or that's what I think at least, up until the end. Although, commanding the AI or waiting for them to move can be a tad annoying, AI still need to be improved a lot. I'll leave it at that to avoid spoilers. Healing system actually seems kind of worse than Arma 2. The First aid kits everyone has heal you up 75%, so you're not totally good to go, but it still makes medics feel useless. Again, you'll need mods like AGM or XMedSys to get past the healing system. Content remains a bit lacking still. There's only a few civilian cars, literally no women of any kind, and no civilian aviation. Also, NATO, CSAT, and the AAF all lack any kind of transport plane. The only new sort of vehicle they added was either the Tempest "Device" or the Bobcat, a Panther APC that clears mines by plowing them. Also, the AAF only has mortars for artillery, which isn't good against NATO with their 155mm guns and 230mm rockets, or CSAT's 155mm guns and 82mm mortars. Also, CSAT lacks rocket artillery. Fun. And, back to aviation, NATO and CSAT don't have an air superiority fighter like the F-15 or anything, which interestingly is where the AAF makes up. If combat photography is your deal, Arma 3 delivers. You can create some beautiful scenes, or horribly gruesome, to capture with the Splendid Camera. Just go into editor and set it up, and then go to the menu and click splendid camera. The new Zeus feature is a fantastic addition though. Whether being added as a supplement to an existing mission to add challenges or relief depending on how things are going, or making an entirely new mission in the Zeus GM missions, it's usually excellent fun as either the victim or the Zeus, although like most multiplayers it can be ruined by awful people. While it may be clunky at first with the controls or function, when you get the hang of it it's a great tool for making other people's fun, or in SP editor preview, just making things for yourself. Karts are terrible fun. Enough said.Considering all these, I'd give it a 7.5/10. Zeus bumps it up a lot, although the weaker guns against just about any armored soldier, and the weakish sounds take it down some notches, it's still great fun to play.P.S. You should really ignore the people who whine about the "futuristic crap". Seeing as everything ingame is either feasible or already existant, there's really nothing "futuristic". If you wanna see for yourself, check out the forums, with the Arma 3 Is it Authentic? thread.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 19, 2014
												Not entirely sure how much of this game I have really played, given that I simply took advantage of the free weekend (Who knows how long ago) and was hesitant playing it, given that my laptop has the processing power of a potato (And even then I think the potato is lighter, so yet another minus for this thing), on lowest settings in the SinglePlayer Act that was available, I was able to get a terrible 2-10fps. Despite all of this, I still enjoyed literally every second of the picture show that was playing infront of me.Riding in a helicopter, getting to see a limited view of the still beautiful island, seeing the troops and vehicles moving around below me, to shortly after scaling a mountain while taking fire from well camoflagued native soldiers, and rummaging through their gears to find the best sunglasses or helmet I liked, every moment was constant excitement, laughter, or crying behind a rock as I am suppressed and see my squadmate fall and need medical attention.Somehow able to survive all of that, with that terrible tract record, I thought "Hey, I lived, I'm ready for Multiplayer!"Having seen countless, hilarious videos of the Survival (or whatever the name is) gamemode, I joined that first, as a civilian. Not having played much of Arma other then Arma II Free to Play, and even then in terrible Fps, I expected a few people to be slightly hostile, but hoped deep down I'd find a good mate to run with.Shortly after spawning, I found a fully loaded M4-Something or other, nice shades, a backpack, and a cool helmet. A few steps down the road, I found a funny looking Frog-like APC truck, with gas, and decided to take it for a ride. A soldier on an ATV rides up infront of me, I stop and say "Hey! Wanna hop i-" and he's already off, pulled his pistol out and shot me in the face.10/10, this is the driving force for an actual gaming setup. My goal is to find the soldier that shot me, kidnap him, take his clothes, pop his knee caps in the middle of the wasteland, and leave him there.He shall be mine.

content:
Posted: October 7, 2015
												Get 2-3 friends. Play this game. Get some mods. Rinse and repeat. Pros: Two maps with HUNDREDS of locations simulating miles and miles of fully accessable openworld.No two operations are going to be the same. Sandbox with diverse weapons for infanty.Vehicals including multiple variants of cars, trucks, APCs, tanks, helicopters and fixed wing aircraft. Active moding community to adjust everything including core gameplay, adding new maps/locations, enhanced medical systems, and more.  Bouts of boredom and anticipation followed by intense, heartpounding combat. Its the only game where my friends and I can talk about specific firefights we fought together and actually remember what we are talking about. Cons: Enemy AI in the base game is insanely accurate. Often able to hit targets over half a kilometer away with ironsights on an SMG. This is fixed with mods like "bCombat", or by careful editing of text files. High system requirements, (you are usually lucky to get 45fps on a server). There are loads of guides online to maximize your performance, but the game is just so big that the processing power required is going to slow down the game. That being said a friend of mine can run it on a gaming laptop, so you don't need to be ridiculously high end, just dont expect a perfect 60fps experience even on a thousand dollar PC.

												Very interesting choice, I love it, this is my favorite multiplayer game. I play in a Milsim unit and have led them before too. Odds are that you PROBABLY would have already gotten the idea of what the game is like from the preview. This is one of those games where if you are interested you will probably like it, but don't pass it down if you are curious.  -Message me if you are wanting to join a Milsim Unit. Have fun! Worth the price!

content:
Posted: July 31, 2014
												This game is very well done.  It is about as close as you can get to total realism in a game.  This is also somewhat a downside though.  It makes missions being done by yourself without any AI or player assistance very difficult.  But if you have a group of friends to help you take on some of the missions, you will enjoy this game.  The multiplayer is awesome.  Before I found this game, I had always been searching for a game with a gamemode that has teams with about 65 players or so each all fighting over one point.  The workshop feature makes the game even better, being able to download new missions whenever you finish the ones you already have.  This is overall a pretty cool game.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 15, 2013
												While it's definitely lacking in content as of yet, the developers are constantly pushing out more and more to add to the game as time goes on. It has sleek graphics and very realistic gameplay; incidentally, if you're looking for Call of Duty or Battlefield with tight corners and insanely over-powered guns and dumbed-down ballistics, you, sir, have come to the wrong place.As said by Runekn so perfectly:"Arma is not a game which you pick up at launch, play the campaign and a bit of mp, and then trow away. You buy it, love it or hate it, and then play it forever or trow it away immediately."The community is incredibly active, and if the game is missing something (a jet, or faction, or gun), there are modders out there currently hard at work making this game more incredible.At the time of writing, the first of three campaign episodes have come out, the next slated for early next year. The game is becoming more and more intricate as people "leave" ARMA II to rest for a bit while they pursue ARMA III and more Scenarios are being made (thanks to Workshop Integration). Overall, this is an excellent game, and if you're sick of CoD or BF, need a dose of excitement or realism, or just need a satisfying filler while the sequel [of CoD or BF] comes out, ARMA III will give the experience yourself looking for.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
												Before I begin, I want to clarify that I use Arma 3 almost exclusively for multiplayer.  I play with intelligent, skilled friends, and I have been playing Bohemia Interactive games for maybe 6 years (since the early days of Arma 2).Arma 3 is a sensational, infinitely replayable game.  There are hundreds (probably thousands) of multiplayer servers, and between them dozens of different game modes.  The most popular among these include Wasteland, Life, Domination, Battle Royale, et cetera.  There are many variations of each.IF YOU CAN RUN THIS GAME, you will find that it is an immensely satisfying and exhilarating experience.  The heart-stopping, breath-holding feeling you get hiding in a city or treeline from an enemy (player-controlled!) attack helicopter, jet, tank, or infantry fireteam is completely unique to the Arma series.  Even in a game like Battlefield, which many members of the Bohemia Interactive community also (or used to) play, you do not feel the same sense of adrenaline-stuffed excitement.Playing together with skilled friends that know their way around the game will greatly improve the experience, and even if all of your friends are newbies, it can still be fun just to try and play as a team together.  It will only make you all better.Arma can be frustrating at times but you just need to be patient and WILLING TO LEARN.  This is not a plug-and-play shoot-'em-up.  You can get right into the gameplay, but it will take some experience to become great.  Beware that this game is not for everyone, and if you are looking for something with instant, quick action then this is not the game for you.If you can't run this but want to, then you may want to try Arma 2, which still has a strong community base and many different servers.  However, if you are new to the series, Arma 3 is probably the best place to jump into right now.

content:
Posted: February 15, 2016
												this game is everything ive been looking for! been playing nothing but King Of The Hill - but there is so much more to the game I just haven't gotten into the rest of it. many many mods and custom scenaros availble - a very community driven game.the perfect mix, counterstrike meets battlefield meets call of duty, but very different from all three games, set in a very large open free world with the realism level pretty high. it's a war simulation, so you have to be patient and tactical. if you're running around in the open you will get picked off. if you crash into a tree while you are driving a small vechicle at high speed you will die. very rewarding game once you get good. you need teamwork and fluid communication. get a headset. get ready to die 25 times before your first kill, and be ready to have no idea where you got shot from :D take cover and keep your eyes open for movement. a few bugs and glitches here and there but doesn't take away from the game. some issues climbing stairs, weird choppy moments trying to climb over certain objects, noticed a few wall issues too.very happy with this game so far i hope they keep polishing itedit: best game i ever played in my life

												Played arma2, Loved it, Played arma3 and loved it more. High spec systems will push up to 60-70fps but conditional. Script running, current spawned in objects and AI, graphic effects overload will hammer some systems.Overall if youre system is good enough to run it and you can handle maybe turning some effects down on mid systems its an awesome game sure to entertain and war sim lovers. 9/10

Posted: June 30, 2014
												Good game...  better than Arma 2 or Operation Arrowhead....  BUT and a BIIIIIIIG BUTT.  please please please please FIX THE FREAKING AI PILOTING AND DRIVING ALREADY!!!!!!!!!     Ex:   Yesterday I'm playing Arma 3 (Bennys CTI mode), I have 7 M4 Scorchers all parked at HQ with 1 gunner in each.  The plan is to sneak in at about 500m from the objective, use the M4s to eliminate all opposition, then take the objective single handed while the rest of the team is attacking another objective.    I hire a quadbike w/driver, assign the driver as Green Team and jump on the back.  I tell him to move to the next town, and I open the map to select my best approach to the objective.  After selecting my approach I go back to 3rd person view.  We are about 10m past our HQ.  The AI is crashing into a small rock on the side of the road.  Over and over and over and over and over and over again.  To my left there is apx. 10m of wide open road.    :SAll I can say is WTF.  A statement, not a question. WTF.  Not WTF?.  WTF.  Get it.   Anyways good game.  No other game is as extensive as Arma.  I would even call it more a "sim" than a game.  Not a true sim, but a sim none the less.

												Over 900 hours played.  I'm sure I'll be well over 1k when all is said and done.  While the singleplayer campagn is ok, the game's true potential is unlocked in multiplayer.  This is a true military sim built by the same company that builds sim's for the military.  With mods like Breaking Point, Battle Royale, Wasteland, and King of the Hill, it's hard to get bored. number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 8, 2016
												I know a lot of you are probably looking into this game because it's on sale and you have heard a lot about it. The realism, the tactical team based situations, and the wide variety of wepons are amazing! HOWEVER..... I, the mighty Edgar Allan Bro, have a realistic review for this realistic shooter.In all honesty, Arma 3 is much more a strategy game than it is an FPS. You have to use your team, depending on the gametype, and you have to plan out your offense. For instance, I was in a Sector Control match on Stratis. My squad was given the order to move through a village and take an enemy heald building. So, we all chose a class type. I picked up an LMG, a buddy of mine took a DMR, and the others had assault rifles and SMGs. I was to give covering fire while my men moved up through the building and cleared it out. We were doing great until an LAV rolled up and shot all of our men out of the building. What we failed to do was make sure one of us had an anti tank/infantry launcher. You MUST make these decisions in this game. I can't stress this enough. The fanbase is INSANE. If you do something wrong, they will call you out on it. I was shot by a team mate, because I didn't clarify my orders once. The game is a great time to play if you have thick skin and you have a group of friends to play with. The controls can also be VERY overwealimg. every button on your keyboard and mouse has at least two functions.The game has an♥♥♥♥♥load of mods and an♥♥♥♥♥load of RPG games. It is really a sandbox game when it comes to games revolving around RPG elements. Now you may think I'm bashing the game, but I did say I recommend it! I do! It's a great game! SC is a lot of fun and it's very very intense. If you don't want this amount of realism, maybe try playing battlefield on origin, or even DOOM if you want an arena based shooter.I give this game an 8.5/10The only problems are the straight up noobs ♥♥♥♥ing up the flow of the combat and the trolls ♥♥♥♥ing up the flow of the combat. I recommend playing some scenario missions to get the controls and the feel down before jumping into multiplayer. People take this game pretty seriously...-Edgar Allan Bro

content:

												Great game, I like the King of the Hill mode, they seem to be improving it really well. just a lot of buttons, and the steam workshop is a nice touch.Only downside is this games horriable engine. The engine its self is from 2001 and its been pushed beyond what it can really handle on the clients side. Once you start to add about 20 AI or players the engine starts to use the CPU or Video card less and less cuasing a performance drop. I seen maybe 30% CPU/GPU usage on a 106 player King of the hill match with 30 - 35fps hile on armory I can pull well into the 80's with a few players.Thats my only gripe about this game. If they would fix that then I would have no complaints at all.

content:
Posted: July 8, 2016
												I know a lot of you are probably looking into this game because it's on sale and you have heard a lot about it. The realism, the tactical team based situations, and the wide variety of wepons are amazing! HOWEVER..... I, the mighty Edgar Allan Bro, have a realistic review for this realistic shooter.In all honesty, Arma 3 is much more a strategy game than it is an FPS. You have to use your team, depending on the gametype, and you have to plan out your offense. For instance, I was in a Sector Control match on Stratis. My squad was given the order to move through a village and take an enemy heald building. So, we all chose a class type. I picked up an LMG, a buddy of mine took a DMR, and the others had assault rifles and SMGs. I was to give covering fire while my men moved up through the building and cleared it out. We were doing great until an LAV rolled up and shot all of our men out of the building. What we failed to do was make sure one of us had an anti tank/infantry launcher. You MUST make these decisions in this game. I can't stress this enough. The fanbase is INSANE. If you do something wrong, they will call you out on it. I was shot by a team mate, because I didn't clarify my orders once. The game is a great time to play if you have thick skin and you have a group of friends to play with. The controls can also be VERY overwealimg. every button on your keyboard and mouse has at least two functions.The game has an♥♥♥♥♥load of mods and an♥♥♥♥♥load of RPG games. It is really a sandbox game when it comes to games revolving around RPG elements. Now you may think I'm bashing the game, but I did say I recommend it! I do! It's a great game! SC is a lot of fun and it's very very intense. If you don't want this amount of realism, maybe try playing battlefield on origin, or even DOOM if you want an arena based shooter.I give this game an 8.5/10The only problems are the straight up noobs ♥♥♥♥ing up the flow of the combat and the trolls ♥♥♥♥ing up the flow of the combat. I recommend playing some scenario missions to get the controls and the feel down before jumping into multiplayer. People take this game pretty seriously...-Edgar Allan Bro

content:
Posted: April 12, 2015
												I've played this game now for around 135 hours (1st of april 2016) and the reason for this is because, sadly, this is - I'm not going to use the word best because that doesn't really describe anything related to this game - the only available option for this kind of military "simulation".Sure there is Arma 2 but it is essentially the same game but worse graphics.So, the game is a broken♥♥♥♥♥piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥in which you have to scroll through menus to do♥♥♥♥♥♥which is very convenient when in the middle of a firefight, almost revolutionary I'd say. They could just do a radial wheel menu which has all the same options, and could be context sensitive so that the thing you most likely want to do when you point your gun at the door of a car when you are less than a foot away from it would pop up to the top of the radial wheel so you always know where the context sensitive action is on the wheel for quick access. Have reload and some other stuff at left, right and bottom of the wheel and fill in the gaps with something not so often used or let players even customize the menu themselves. Just doing this would make the managment of simple tasks like opening a door when you don't want to pick up that magazine that is under the car much easierInstead they still use menus which are small and you navigate them with your mouse wheel and the best part is when context sensitive stuff starts popping up on the menu things get really funny and it gets even better when you want to do things fast under pressure.Sure, you can use the "Use action key" but it does what it shows on the screen and that might not always be what you want to do, like my example of trying to open/close a door when there is an item in the doorway, in which case the game will most likely just make you pick up the item.Better start practicing that precision scrolling!A simulator where the cars explode(!) when you crash it into anything at high speeds, even a lamb fence is enough sometimes.This is a game made by devs who have never played any modern games and take all their inspiration from their own past games and the only one that they made that was considered "modern" was the original operation flashpoint back in 1998 or something.All their games after that have imitated OF and Arma 3 design is still based on that game (Read: doesn't work very well anymore, or never really did but it was the best they could do in -98)

content:
Posted: March 24
												This game is a mix of feelings. A love - hate relationship if you will.        ----------TL;DR on the bottom-------------The game is amazing. Milsims, the mods, various gamemodes provided by Bohemia and the community.Sure, the community tends to be toxic and d*cks, especially in modes like Wasteland and other Co-ooperation gamemodes where you need to work as a team. But those people are most of the time easily ignored.The biggest downfall of this game, and i think every single person that has ever launched play on this game agrees, is the performance. It has gotten noticeably stable with x64 rolling out some time ago and that's helped the case a bit but overall it's still very, very, VERY un-enjoyable at times. Having spent 1.7k hours on this game i've spent most of my time playing with 30 FPS at average while my "rig" can easily reach over the minimum requirements. Speaking of which, thats one of the things that decieve players/buyers/users that are looking into buying a game such as this one, the requirements tab you find above the tab where you're reading this review. You know, that Minimum and Reccomended sys. requirements? Yeah, that's complete and utter bullsh*t. Maybe it couldve held true if the game had been optimised but at the moment of this review being written and before, everyone knows it's false as the statement that Russians despise of Vodka. Even the "beast-est" of rigs cannot run this game properly. The thing that YOU NEED in this game is single core performance, which can be achieved easily with overclocking your CPU. You may have six cores and octa cores but that's just extra numbers for the game to ignore, it barely uses 3-4 cores as it is. Like i said, SINGLE CORE PERFORMANCE is the key to achieving an enjoyable framerate. GPUs don't do much, other than help with textures and resolution settings, AO, AA , PPAA and so on.The gameplay is amazing, so much to choose from, from the campaign to the widely extensive  multiplayer mode that this game focuses on mainly. You have official modes such as Zeus, End Game and others and then you have modded modes such as Wasteland (which isnt really modded, it's just modified vanilla) and then Exile, which is an amazing mod btw, except for the bots that shoot you from a kilometer away from where they are and you haven't even came close to even looking at them. But that's only the top of the list. One mod of hundreds of thousands for you to choose from. Endless fun really, depending on what kind of action you prefer. Altough keep in mind that more mods sometimes equals lesser performance and ALOT of troubleshooting, unless you're lucky as hell.Movement is decent, alot of stances to choose from. Pretty much every one of the 3 main stances have atleast 2 "sub-stances" if you will. Play through bootcamp and or watch some videos or do the showcases that Bohemia provided for your education on how to properly play this game. Altough keep in mind, you can die from falling 5m off a ledge, and sometimes you can get glitched in certain terrain and die out of thin air.Mainly this game is alooooot of fun. Especially with friends. You get alot of shennanigans, mainly from some of the bugs and glitches this game has to "provide".This game has alot of those. Bugs and glitches. You can't play this game without experience most of them. You come to get used to them and overcome some of them, that are able to be overcome but there are some gamebreaking ones that just make you furious at times.Bohemia doesn't really care about all that much, i mean i hate to say it, they've made an amazing game but lately i dont know what's going on with their minds. From my perspective as i see it, they either don't know what they're doing or are just lazy as hell to do it anyways. You might experiece this very likely if you contact support regarding their product. You'l be asked to do some potential fixes to your problem but only find out that they give up after like 3 suggestions they provide for you and realise they dont work. There's a fair number of errors and glitches and crashes they've havent fixed and have been present for TOO. LONG. A great example of such error is UNABLE_TO_INIT_DXGI. The error has been present for nearly 2 years yet they haven't been even interested in acknowledging it's existence. They're completely ignoring these errors and not caring about them and just making DLCs instead of fixing their game to make it run smoother and more enjoyable.TL;DR : Game is great, decent ammount of bugs and glitches and errors the devs dont give a flying f*ck about to fix or deal with in general, lower than average performance, but the gameplay and shennanigans make it all worth it. You learn to love the lower performance compared to other games but the gameplay and shennanigans man. Priceless stuff :)

content:
Posted: April 29, 2014
												this game has many modified servers making it worth every penny, and even though it has a full inventory of vehicles it is incredibly difficult to stop playing even if you change server it has details you will not find in most games of its kind. on different servers and on singleplayer mode it is not a walkover, and you are challenged with the full feel and suppression war brings with good graphics quality  and huge map enviroments citys and towns to explore. i feel as this game should win more awards just for the playability alone and incredibly varied choice of things to do in game its quite simply  never ending ,  the maps are very very big. 20km  what game makes you travel that distance and your still not quite where you want to be .there is always a little more to see with all the mods that are being done in multiplayer  £20 this cost me on a pre release alpha . the best money i have ever spent so much so i bought 4 friends a copy of this game ....... and ive never done that in 30 years of gaming.update ....the amount of hours i have put into arma 3 is over 4000 now  mainly on one multiplayer server .but having tried many i feel happy with the life servers . ALTIS LIFE at  ts @ sealteamsloth.comthe life servers replicate working robberies, bank heists and many both legal and  illegal activities .an all round well blanced community helps . but hard to keep trhat way at times with new people just not reading the rules ,copying  their watched videos and trolling to no end . hysterical at times the wasteland is an obvious military style  game type with an arsenal of weapons  to be found by scavenging around the island  then by team blue or red you take the fight to the enemy . or you go solo in greenfor killing anyone in sight . so a more single minded tactical strategy is needed to survive .  one can get weapons by buying them at often with enemy watching gunstores .so an all round awareness is needed to get in and get out alive as its often a sniper haven area . the sights on your weapon are vital to success at distances exceeding 200 metres or more .and can be found around the islands and gunstores .the ability to get your soldier to settle before shooting in distance fire is needed to aim accurately.i cannot stress this enough at long range shooting distances.often a soldier on the slow move is the best at distance and close up contact . but it is terrain dependant also . the best way to find out your weakness is to play on a public game server .with the weapons of your choice . one has to just get in the game to get better at it .  map, navigation and compass are vital tools to easily find your destination and objectives .strategy is needed on most game modes and servers with many choices and decisions to make a quick game experience of  different game servers will help you improve your skills .the ARMA£editor, is a a 3d enviroment now with many tactical options and decisions to be made .with arma 3 you can play for a year and still not be anywhere near completion of the game .it is the best money i have personally ever spent on a game . there are always new mods and options to try new servers with arma 3 .one just has to get into the role and read the rules set by the server where applicable or needed. many servers have admins watching / playing which helps out a lot with issues and glitches we find as arma 3 progresses to a better experience for us  all.  failures .glitchy actions sometimes the occasional lying down to stand glitch can happen . but overall a great experience when using teamspeak which is free to download as a communication aid between you and your team .  there is other in game communications and chat one can use . task force radio  being one also.my first server i ever played on was an american server an experience i cant forget . the bravado and communication skills are needed to communicate in a effective manner  so a microphone is needed for quicker communication in your team or group, even groups can communicate individually and between each other with channel commander and task force radio options .sound .well you will need to adjust your sound options turning down the music and renaming your soldier in your profile to suit your batallion or group  you play with . optional. in profile .some servers have built in ear supression  by pressing a few keys together so only chat can be heard.  and other sounds reduced .in game view distances are a helpful aid also to aid in viewing enemys so adjust accordingly between playability and safety. graphical quality ... arma 3 will use whatever you throw at it and you can still not get full view distances unless you use the top graphics cards out there and often in sli or dual configurations .but anything from an NVIDIA 750ti or higher should help more .the Nvidia 970 is  best for price today so dual cards will beat a 980 but not on GDDR5 memory as it cancels to 4 gig on the 970.so be warned  get a good system with intel 4th generation or above  i5 or i7 series cpu, to get the best from arma3 .yes 6th genertion cpu,s will beast this game the 6700k is probably the best option. today .but not needed  should you not have it you will still gain by using a high core cpu  even on AMD systems one can have a great experience for less money as many gamers do . quad core  4ghz is a fair balance as arma 3 is cpu intensive. on 1 core , but one can change the pc options to perform better should one need to.a good sound program is vital if you need to survive long on arma 3 , but not absolutely vital to play the game .  5.1 0r 7.1 headsets are a bonus and work just  on lesser priced pc,s through the usb or front jack options. razer are an effective way to quickly gain surround sound in game and the higher priced turtle beaches are an option also but if im fussy i would use the Astro A40 or astro A50 to get some real sound quality to the game .so the learning curve is high when coming from battlefied 3 or 4 or counter strike  games .but the footstep function can save you or your team  if you have it  in close town battles .a well coordinated team policy is just part of the excellence that arma can provide when engagements are in your sights .the game updates are just an important  part of playing arma so do it often or when they are shown.see you on the game if you have the right stuff. you probably do ,and if you do not .you soon will.

content:
Posted: May 16, 2016
												Arma 3 is an amazing game, however I'd reccomend doing your research before considering purchasing it. I personally am not a massive fan of "life" servers or that sorta thing, and I think public servers that try to be tactical are (with the exeption of a select few) mostly terrible. The base game has a decent ammount of content, but I personally can't deal with the AI and can't stand the single player. The BEST thing about Arma 3 is mods. Mods, Mods, Mods. Mods fix many of Arma's intrinsic problems and provide you with more content than you could ever want. It turns Arma from an okay-shooter to... well, pretty much anything. Life servers, Milsim groups, more relaxed tactical groups (my preference) - Arma 3 is the BEST sandbox shooter out there and, assuming there's something you're interested in, it's definately worth the price.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 14, 2015
												Arma 3 is one of the best games for your money (especially if you buy it on sale) simply because of the sheer potential. Whether you want to play single player, multiplayer, PVE, PVP, long campaigns, short missions, fly jets, fly choppers, drive tanks, trucks, IFVS, or create your own missions it's all there.Arma 3 boasts the best ballistics of any game out there. Firefights are truly enjoyable, and thoroughly heart pounding. You can be getting shot at from 10m or less or more than 1000m. Bullets travel in arcs, and you must learn to adjust your aim according to the distance of your target. It is like for every weapon, and vehicular weapon. Concealment, and camouflage are also realistic, and effective and add to the feel of the game. The multiplayer aspect is definitely this game's strongest point. There are a ton of different game types. From various sandbox survival mods, RPG mods like altis life, CQC oriented KOTH, to Zeus gameplay that allows scenarios/missions to be edited on the fly by a game master. Now all this positive stuff isn't without some downsides. The most serious issue in my opinion is the way you get past obtacles is stupid as hell. Half the time you just clip through/into a low wall, or into a short set of stairs instead of climbing over it. I have accidently hit the key and walked through a tower wall to my death. This clipping can also happen unintentionally without using the key around doorways, into the floor, or through walls. As frustrating as this can be it is not game breaking, just annoying. Commanding friendly AI is also a huge pain in the♥♥♥♥♥ and makes single player games more frustrating. The hardware requirements to run smoothly are quite demanding, and could be beyond what some people's rigs can handle without looking too ♥♥♥♥♥♥ to play effectively.*edit*This is my nomination for test of time. I keep coming back to it, and it has ruined other military games for me.

content:
Posted: July 10, 2016
												Bohemia Interactive Fans have been waiting 4 years for the next instalment of their most favourite PC open world military tactical Shooter franchise, Arma 3. Tacking place on the Aegean islands of Altis and Stratis of Greece with both Islands featuring the largess terrain of 290 km2 for any Arma game, Arma has never been so open world before. The islands features over 50 renamed villages with buildings that are both penetrable and destructible. The islands also include all sorts of kinds of wild life ranging from goats to grass snakes, bunnies to butterflies and even sharks and sea turtles in the surrounding waters. The republic of Altis and Stratis is populated by 5 unique factions that includes NATO and CSAT alongside the local AAF, FAIA gorillas and the civilian population. Each faction has their own motives, characteristics, vehicles and weapons.Arma 3 contains over 20 Vehicles including tanks, cars, helicopters, aircraft and quads that can be driven by players in the game. Plus, there is a selection of over 40 weapons to choose from that can be customised with their own types of scopes and other various types of attachments. Each type of weapons has its own handling, sway and recoil meaning that a Sub Machine gun is much easy to handle at close range then a sniper rifle. Arma 3 is so tactical, it features 15 types of stances that can be very useful in exposing the least amount of your body to the enemy. Although, Arma 3 has realistic ballistic penetration physics depending on weapon type, attachments, material, calibre and distance meaning that hiding behind a wooden fence or plaster wall may not really be a suitable type of cover. In Arma 3 you will have to be careful about how much weight you’re caring which can have effect on stamina. Arma 3 features a realistic night sky which can be useful when you are lost on Altis without a compass as the stars can be used to navigate. There is reasons why so many military veterans are into the Arma franchise. “Arma 3 makes Call of Duty look like a kid’s game.” If you’re a new player to Arma 3 and are intimidated by the large amount of complexity to such a realistic open world military tactical Shooter then you can start off with boot camp. Recently introduced in a free update it offers up a single payer tutorial campaign and virtual reality training topics.Arma 3's multiplayer is where the game really shines. Servers can have up to 100 players in all out warfare. Other than the vanilla game modes there is a bunch of community made game modes including the very popular DayZ zombie survival game mode. Arma 3 comes with a free DLC called Zeus which can be used create multiplayer scenarios from a birds eye view perspective. Arma 3 content creators also can easily create and save multilayer scenarios by using the in game scenario editor in a matter of minutes. Arma 3 content can be shared and downloaded over the steam workshop with over 10,000 scenarios and addons that have been published and is growing each day. There have been Arma 3 content creation contests with prizes veering from €20,000 to €200,000.Arma 3's new graphic engine unleashes the full potential of PC gaming. Fans will notice that the new real virtuality 4 engine Is great improvement over Arma 2's engine implementing all sorts of new changes with significant improvements to animations and sounds, combined with the introduction of Microsoft directx 11 and Nvdia physX™, the battlefields of Arma have never felt more real. However Despite being the 4th version of the real virtuality engine it’s still heavily based on the decade old Bohemia Interactive real virtuality game engine that is known for its poor optimisation leading to poor performance making it very demanding on PC hardware, epically when there are allot of AI’s.Arma 3 Averages reviews of 9/10 (55,000 being positive and only 6,000 negative) on steam. You can download the game now at a standard selling price of $39.99 USD off steam. Although, a steam sale would put a huge discount on the standard sale price if you choose to wait for one. I would recommend getting the Apex Edition as it’s come with all the DLC’s and the just recently released Apex expansion which is currently 20% of. With the game being constantly updated and having constant flow of community made content, the game is a must buy for any PC gamer. As expected for any Arma game it requires a very beathy gaming PC with both a powerful Graphics Card and processor so we recommend that you make sure that your system is well over the games system requirements before you make your purchase. A PC with an Intel core i7 processor and a strong graphic card along the lines of an Nvdia GTX 970 or AMD r9 390 would be an ideal system for Arma 3. Installing Arma 3 on an SSD would also lead to much faster loading times. Pros - Open world with eye dropping graphics- Realistic tactical Shooter- Amazing campaign that reliably produces stories- Large Varity of over 20 vehicles including tanks, cars, helicopters, aircraft and quads that can bedriven by players in the game- Selection of over 40 weapons to choose from that can be customised with their own types ofscopes and other various types of attachments- 15 types of stances that be very useful in exposing the least amount of your body to the enemy- Realistic weapon Ballistics- Servers can have up to 100 players in all out warfare- Community made content Cons -Highly PC system demanding-poorly optimised game engine

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 30, 2015
												This game is really quite good. It wholly deserves the 60 dollar price in my opinion, and that is true to form. There has been a huge amount of work put into the game. Its scale and the seriousness with which it was handled by its developers absolutely deserves them the full 60 dollars. This game puts even next gen games to the test. It is fantastic. I will relay some of my experiences with the game:Personally I am a HUGE fan of the lighting in the game. The dark is really dark, and the light is really light. The light is in fact just beautiful. There is nothing like driving in the night with your headlights on, and stopping somewhere with the light of your headlights to work by. Or moving through the dark in the morning, with a flashlight and a lighthouse far above you to keep things clear. Even tracers are quite well done, and you will constantly be taken aback by the absolute beauty and accuracy of both the lighting and the environment.On to the environment. The environment is enormous. Hills, plains, farmland, valleys. It is all very well designed and is covered by very accurate and realistic looking flora which all server the purpose of providing some very useful and much needed cover. The scale of things is just huge, and is enough to blow ones mind. It is really something, standing on a hill 1 km away from an enemy platoon on the face of another and exchanging fire. That is what battle is, and that is really the scale that stands true to the test as what Arma is really about.The vehicles are also a great part of the game, they are all EXTREMELY meticulously designed, and appear to be very much the real thing. In some ways, different, but you will not mind your long commutes via chopper or land solely because of the eye candy that is your ride.The gunfire is a bit disappointing, however. Firing ones gun is not as much a pleasure as it may be in other games. It does not convey the same detail or intricate beauty that other parts of the game do, and does not feel nearly so powerful. I am not sure as to why this might be, but the guns are just so... light. I would like to see some more impressively realistic muzzle flare and gun interaction.Additionally, the AI in the game is very flawed and can certainly leave one disappointed, especially during showcase missions. When I would like to play with a fully interactive AI, I meet soldiers who are completely unresponsive, downright born with autism and having a heart attack, or are just altogether far too quick to respond and accurate, just like a robot. The AI opponents often leave one shaking their head at the huge holes in interactability, especially on missions where otherwise this would be the focus of the game.In total, however, the game is huge. If you are interested in the sort of fully fledged MILSIM combat that this game has to offer, please get it. I assure you that there is nothing else like this out there, and this is a game of its own. The creators had a mission, and that mission was achieved. Be responsible when you are flying your intricately designed helicopters or blazing tracer rounds at enemy soldiers down the ravine. Its fun stuff, and you never know where that may lead.

content:
Posted: August 19, 2014
												Not entirely sure how much of this game I have really played, given that I simply took advantage of the free weekend (Who knows how long ago) and was hesitant playing it, given that my laptop has the processing power of a potato (And even then I think the potato is lighter, so yet another minus for this thing), on lowest settings in the SinglePlayer Act that was available, I was able to get a terrible 2-10fps. Despite all of this, I still enjoyed literally every second of the picture show that was playing infront of me.Riding in a helicopter, getting to see a limited view of the still beautiful island, seeing the troops and vehicles moving around below me, to shortly after scaling a mountain while taking fire from well camoflagued native soldiers, and rummaging through their gears to find the best sunglasses or helmet I liked, every moment was constant excitement, laughter, or crying behind a rock as I am suppressed and see my squadmate fall and need medical attention.Somehow able to survive all of that, with that terrible tract record, I thought "Hey, I lived, I'm ready for Multiplayer!"Having seen countless, hilarious videos of the Survival (or whatever the name is) gamemode, I joined that first, as a civilian. Not having played much of Arma other then Arma II Free to Play, and even then in terrible Fps, I expected a few people to be slightly hostile, but hoped deep down I'd find a good mate to run with.Shortly after spawning, I found a fully loaded M4-Something or other, nice shades, a backpack, and a cool helmet. A few steps down the road, I found a funny looking Frog-like APC truck, with gas, and decided to take it for a ride. A soldier on an ATV rides up infront of me, I stop and say "Hey! Wanna hop i-" and he's already off, pulled his pistol out and shot me in the face.10/10, this is the driving force for an actual gaming setup. My goal is to find the soldier that shot me, kidnap him, take his clothes, pop his knee caps in the middle of the wasteland, and leave him there.He shall be mine.

content:
Posted: June 16, 2014
												Having bought this on day one, I do not regret it. I'll start with the gun play. Small arms feel weak against anyone wearing a vest, taking more than two shots to kill sometimes even with the almighty 7.62. However, if you play a scenario without body armor of any kind you should have a deadlier match. While I wish BI would fix the problem themselves, the Authentic Gameplay mod seems to help, or at least it makes me wanna go back to an Arma 3 firefight. Driving vehicles feels a lot smoother than Arma 2 in my opinion, thanks to PhysX. A lot of it is still off though, for example, the karts turn ridiculously fast. It's no GTA IV in the driving department, but it's clear they're making improvements over past installments in this department. Sounds are... acceptable. It's clear why sound mods are always so popular for the Arma series. They smoothened out the dialogue, but gun sounds sound weaker and quieter, though they can still be heard from some distance. The campaign is good improvement over the past, or that's what I think at least, up until the end. Although, commanding the AI or waiting for them to move can be a tad annoying, AI still need to be improved a lot. I'll leave it at that to avoid spoilers. Healing system actually seems kind of worse than Arma 2. The First aid kits everyone has heal you up 75%, so you're not totally good to go, but it still makes medics feel useless. Again, you'll need mods like AGM or XMedSys to get past the healing system. Content remains a bit lacking still. There's only a few civilian cars, literally no women of any kind, and no civilian aviation. Also, NATO, CSAT, and the AAF all lack any kind of transport plane. The only new sort of vehicle they added was either the Tempest "Device" or the Bobcat, a Panther APC that clears mines by plowing them. Also, the AAF only has mortars for artillery, which isn't good against NATO with their 155mm guns and 230mm rockets, or CSAT's 155mm guns and 82mm mortars. Also, CSAT lacks rocket artillery. Fun. And, back to aviation, NATO and CSAT don't have an air superiority fighter like the F-15 or anything, which interestingly is where the AAF makes up. If combat photography is your deal, Arma 3 delivers. You can create some beautiful scenes, or horribly gruesome, to capture with the Splendid Camera. Just go into editor and set it up, and then go to the menu and click splendid camera. The new Zeus feature is a fantastic addition though. Whether being added as a supplement to an existing mission to add challenges or relief depending on how things are going, or making an entirely new mission in the Zeus GM missions, it's usually excellent fun as either the victim or the Zeus, although like most multiplayers it can be ruined by awful people. While it may be clunky at first with the controls or function, when you get the hang of it it's a great tool for making other people's fun, or in SP editor preview, just making things for yourself. Karts are terrible fun. Enough said.Considering all these, I'd give it a 7.5/10. Zeus bumps it up a lot, although the weaker guns against just about any armored soldier, and the weakish sounds take it down some notches, it's still great fun to play.P.S. You should really ignore the people who whine about the "futuristic crap". Seeing as everything ingame is either feasible or already existant, there's really nothing "futuristic". If you wanna see for yourself, check out the forums, with the Arma 3 Is it Authentic? thread.

content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
												Before I begin, I want to clarify that I use Arma 3 almost exclusively for multiplayer.  I play with intelligent, skilled friends, and I have been playing Bohemia Interactive games for maybe 6 years (since the early days of Arma 2).Arma 3 is a sensational, infinitely replayable game.  There are hundreds (probably thousands) of multiplayer servers, and between them dozens of different game modes.  The most popular among these include Wasteland, Life, Domination, Battle Royale, et cetera.  There are many variations of each.IF YOU CAN RUN THIS GAME, you will find that it is an immensely satisfying and exhilarating experience.  The heart-stopping, breath-holding feeling you get hiding in a city or treeline from an enemy (player-controlled!) attack helicopter, jet, tank, or infantry fireteam is completely unique to the Arma series.  Even in a game like Battlefield, which many members of the Bohemia Interactive community also (or used to) play, you do not feel the same sense of adrenaline-stuffed excitement.Playing together with skilled friends that know their way around the game will greatly improve the experience, and even if all of your friends are newbies, it can still be fun just to try and play as a team together.  It will only make you all better.Arma can be frustrating at times but you just need to be patient and WILLING TO LEARN.  This is not a plug-and-play shoot-'em-up.  You can get right into the gameplay, but it will take some experience to become great.  Beware that this game is not for everyone, and if you are looking for something with instant, quick action then this is not the game for you.If you can't run this but want to, then you may want to try Arma 2, which still has a strong community base and many different servers.  However, if you are new to the series, Arma 3 is probably the best place to jump into right now.

												this game is everything ive been looking for! been playing nothing but King Of The Hill - but there is so much more to the game I just haven't gotten into the rest of it. many many mods and custom scenaros availble - a very community driven game.the perfect mix, counterstrike meets battlefield meets call of duty, but very different from all three games, set in a very large open free world with the realism level pretty high. it's a war simulation, so you have to be patient and tactical. if you're running around in the open you will get picked off. if you crash into a tree while you are driving a small vechicle at high speed you will die. very rewarding game once you get good. you need teamwork and fluid communication. get a headset. get ready to die 25 times before your first kill, and be ready to have no idea where you got shot from :D take cover and keep your eyes open for movement. a few bugs and glitches here and there but doesn't take away from the game. some issues climbing stairs, weird choppy moments trying to climb over certain objects, noticed a few wall issues too.very happy with this game so far i hope they keep polishing itedit: best game i ever played in my life
